commit_message:
Packetbeat: Update daemonset template with selector matchLabels

This updates the elastic-packetbeat chart to include the selector
matchLabels key in the daemonset template, as this is required in
the apps/v1 daemonset spec

Change-Id: I7d3a2f53b4558731a2a2870df3e69b38cddd866f

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I1b98c34b0ab39123c4489bb638c96f726c2bdb88

Typically, non-executable files should have 660 or 600 and executable
files and directories should have 770. All should be owned by the
'config_owner_user' and 'config_owner_group' variables.

This change adds a script to check the owner and permissions of config

Change-Id: Icdbabf36e284b9030017a0dc07b9dc81a37758ab

'config_owner_user' and 'config_owner_group' variables.

This change adds a script to check the owner and permissions of config

commit_message:
Check configuration file permissions in CI

Typically, non-executable files should have 660 or 600 and executable
files and directories should have 770. All should be owned by the
'config_owner_user' and 'config_owner_group' variables.

This change adds a script to check the owner and permissions of config
files under /etc/kolla, and runs it at the end of CI jobs.

Change-Id: Icdbabf36e284b9030017a0dc07b9dc81a37758ab
Related-Bug: #1821579
(cherry picked from commit 8c4ab41ffa502a58714819e0407f3c17e6fde7d0)

commit_message:
Fix the summary table border not rendering

This patch fixes the summary table border to render properly when
other CSS content uses no border for tables.
It also sets the table font size to medium, improving the space used
by the summary table as well as the look of the table.

Change-Id: I0f2bdee6eb67753f5f365b2681c4c7e3ae35c3ec

commit_message:
Fix driver links rendering in the summary table

This patch fixes driver links to render properly in the summary table.
Previously, when a "link" was defined for a driver, the driver titles
were not clickable and the driver link was not used.

Change-Id: I08c45e4f1bd7b206cdc3896ee4dc049bbc4347a2

commit_message:
Don't use easy_install on Ubuntu 18+

Currently easy_install is not available on Ubuntu 18+ due to [1]. In
that case, install pip via apt rather than easy_install.

[1]
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/python-setuptools/+bug/1774419

Change-Id: Id358fdb655d71490b0915680dff131cfe33f4a40
Closes-Bug: #1813492
(cherry picked from commit c1c02f67dcb28a8722d505ddf6a24a37c1f874d7)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-10 09:24:30.000000000', 'message': 'Update quickstart instructions

* Recommend using a virtual environment
* Fix reference to multinode inventory
* Add explicit use of sudo where necessary
* Change ownership of /etc/kolla to current user

These changes should make it possible to copy/paste from the quickstart
to get a working deployment.

Change-Id: Ib3990f9e16eaa1e19a4ad5bfea5bdb2e4bc1c333
(cherry picked from commit b81a43418bc3ffd45f9d2d99c9a3fcdfda5a0d4d)
'}]
commit_message:
Update quickstart instructions

* Recommend using a virtual environment
* Fix reference to multinode inventory
* Add explicit use of sudo where necessary
* Change ownership of /etc/kolla to current user

These changes should make it possible to copy/paste from the quickstart
to get a working deployment.

Change-Id: Ib3990f9e16eaa1e19a4ad5bfea5bdb2e4bc1c333
(cherry picked from commit b81a43418bc3ffd45f9d2d99c9a3fcdfda5a0d4d)

commit_message:
Fix up config file permissions on the host

Several config file permissions are incorrect on the host. In general,
files should be 0660, and directories and executables 0770.

Change-Id: Id276ac1864f280554e98b937f2845bb424d521de
Closes-Bug: #1821579
(cherry picked from commit a4bb8567da3e0e1468d66048c5b46cdeefcb1332)

Copy the CSS into the built docs

This patch adds code that copies the CSS file into the _static
directory on build. Previously the CSS file was not included in the
built docs.

[{'created': '2019-04-12 17:24:00.000000000', 'message': 'Fix CSS handling on build

The sphinx add_stylesheet() method was renamed in sphinx 1.8 to
add_css_file(). This patch updates that and also adds code to copy
the CSS file into the _static directory on build. Previously the CSS
file was not included in the built docs.

Change-Id: Id6eb1f81928fe397352e9daf3673df46aadcc1dd
'}, {'created': '2019-04-12 17:53:15.000000000', 'message': 'Fix CSS handling on build

The sphinx add_stylesheet() method was renamed in sphinx 1.8 to
add_css_file(). This patch updates that and also adds code to copy
the CSS file into the _static directory on build. Previously the CSS
file was not included in the built docs.

Change-Id: Id6eb1f81928fe397352e9daf3673df46aadcc1dd
'}, {'created': '2019-04-13 00:00:26.000000000', 'message': 'Fix deprecated add_stylesheet with add_css_file

The sphinx add_stylesheet() method was renamed in sphinx 1.8 to
add_css_file()[1]. This patch replaces the use of add_stylesheet()
with add_css_file().

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/commit/ \
    3afc72fba41f945610263be79d14c95d21478248

Change-Id: Id6eb1f81928fe397352e9daf3673df46aadcc1dd
'}]
commit_message:
Fix deprecated add_stylesheet with add_css_file

The sphinx add_stylesheet() method was renamed in sphinx 1.8 to
add_css_file()[1]. This patch replaces the use of add_stylesheet()
with add_css_file().

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/commit/ \
    3afc72fba41f945610263be79d14c95d21478248

Change-Id: Id6eb1f81928fe397352e9daf3673df46aadcc1dd

commit_message:
Allow value overrides in CI

This allows to pass a new env var into shell scripts, for value
overrides, with Zuul's help (value_overrides can be part of the
job definition).

Change-Id: Ia5dcecb73f4b872fd8fb65d3cd0bf69c19addf07

commit_message:
[WIP] Update image links for Ceph.

Updated the links according the decision here [1].
The convention for images is <imagename>:<tagging>
where <tagging> takes the format <version>-<distro>.

[1]: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-helm/%23openstack-helm.2019-03-07.log.html#t2019-03-07T17:50:58

Change-Id: I744848187b76646a590e7e4b8cbdbc285b9a215f

commit_message:
Run jobs under python2 and python3

-Switch functional job to run under python3
-Create a functional job to run under python2
-Create a tempest job to run under python2
-Create tox env to run functional tests under python3
-Validate if `USE_PYTHON3` is set to `True` to call
the correct env for tests
-Remove hardcoded path for client when running functional tests
- Update tests failures to work for python2 and python3

Change-Id: I96d418f08c46add8bf61bf8d1b4e45b6083b8d84
(cherry picked from commit 9b881cb973bc2219df90c2b71e2a1d0e18dcd98a)

[{'created': '2019-03-26 15:35:49.000000000', 'message': 'Move to zuulv3

To move ironicclient legacy jobs to zuulv3 the the following changes
were necessary:

- Change `tox.ini` to pass envrioment variables
- Clean `post_test_hook.sh` to avoid legacy variables (`$USER` and
`$BASE`), removing `generate_testr_results` function since we only
get `testrepository.subunit` in logs and the results of the tests
are present in job-output file.
- Convert `post_test_hook.sh` and `run_functional.sh` into
`playbooks/functional/run.yaml` to run after the setup.

Change-Id: I6a5b3f82c238083b66bdf6f379092260d367d82d
(cherry picked from commit 2c349cc8930897052e66d29a70e1e7f1c4d40d79)

To move ironicclient legacy jobs to zuulv3 the the following changes
were necessary:

- Change `tox.ini` to pass envrioment variables
- Clean `post_test_hook.sh` to avoid legacy variables (`$USER` and
`$BASE`), removing `generate_testr_results` function since we only
get `testrepository.subunit` in logs and the results of the tests
are present in job-output file.
- Convert `post_test_hook.sh` and `run_functional.sh` into

Also includes the changes from commit
9cd6ce7eb2d96a8f58a4d00f85b405babf67d28f

Change-Id: I6a5b3f82c238083b66bdf6f379092260d367d82d

commit_message:
Move to zuulv3

To move ironicclient legacy jobs to zuulv3 the the following changes
were necessary:

- Change `tox.ini` to pass envrioment variables
- Clean `post_test_hook.sh` to avoid legacy variables (`$USER` and
`$BASE`), removing `generate_testr_results` function since we only
get `testrepository.subunit` in logs and the results of the tests
are present in job-output file.
- Convert `post_test_hook.sh` and `run_functional.sh` into
`playbooks/functional/run.yaml` to run after the setup.

Also includes the changes from commit
9cd6ce7eb2d96a8f58a4d00f85b405babf67d28f

Change-Id: I6a5b3f82c238083b66bdf6f379092260d367d82d
(cherry picked from commit 2c349cc8930897052e66d29a70e1e7f1c4d40d79)

This patch adds the Debian jobs for this role to make sure
it's always passing as well as updates the meta to reflect
it's support of Debian accordingly.

Change-Id: I4a91a49c5b190344512e8b64da3bccfb7416357c
(cherry picked from commit d2a566a3aac8d943d59e3ee0e2f2ff1ffb216e13)

commit_message:
Delete shadow users when domain is deleted

Without this change, when an admin tries to delete an LDAP-backed
domain, it fails due to the foreign key relationship in the users table.
Previously, we were assuming that LDAP users existed solely in the LDAP
directory, but this is not true with shadow users. This patch fixes the
logic to delete the shadow users upon domain deletion.

Altered cherry-pick: use injected API provider since provider_api
mechanism doesn't exist in pike.

Change-Id: I12a08001e3aa08e4db9438cae425ad1a0a8070f7
Closes-bug: #1801873
(cherry picked from commit 1b16725d066f71a833ca74656c0c3dfe5f815e98)

commit_message:
Handle DBConnectionError in skip_if_timeout decorator

In some cases it may happen that when db test will fail due
to timeout oslo_db.exception.DBConnectionError will be raised
instead of sqlalchemy_exc.InterfaceError.
This patch adds handling such case in skip_if_timeout decorator.

Change-Id: I7350d5c884784317c94ff42f28526065ff399b40
Related-Bug: #1687027
(cherry picked from commit b7458b615972dc6ff93a12abbd0a8f32e8da55eb)

commit_message:
Ignore VolumeAttachmentNotFound exception in compute.manager

DriverVolumeBlockDevice will delete volume attachment when attach
fails, codes link:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/907c7d2cf/nova/virt/block_device.py#L561-L568
However, nova.compute.manager will delete it again and it will raise
VolumeAttachmentNotFound exception. This outputs an incorrect error
log and this exception should be ignored.

NOTE(mriedem): There are a couple of Queens-only changes to the
unit test due to I4436f5c1cc819c55ca9186bda0362bb74555c95a and
Id587967ea4f9980c292492e2f659bf55fb037b28 not being in stable/queens.

Change-Id: I939c09e5b0efb3b17a9855af227e6d60c64d23e2
Closes-Bug: #1812969
(cherry picked from commit 595866eb62db56fbd4f965619031ac902f99441a)
(cherry picked from commit 1a684f6fbef941de88556ec023860ab532938d88)

commit_message:
Enable test_volume_backed_live_migration with block migration

We skipped this as part of bug 1524898 because of it's high
failure rate, but that was before we were using UCA packages.
Now that we have libvirt 2.5.0 and QEMU 2.8 we should see if
this has gotten any better.

If this works OK, we can also try enabling the test again for
the ceph runs.

Change-Id: I4f0793a74cb82339c9fce47a3008c2e3e1efe109
Related-Bug: #1524898

commit_message:
debian: add support

This patch updates the meta to reflect it's support
of Debian accordingly as well as rename ubuntu vars
file to debian.

We also add in vars/debian the correspondent docker-ce
uri and gpg_uri.

Change-Id: Icf91eee6e369d9a6a95dd0c8772c2760eaff5bd2
(cherry picked from commit 98701abb97c0f0e36b32eb9d4d97059d0a094c59)

[{'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-04-02 15:58:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-04-02 16:02:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-nova-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/46/452546/1/check/gate-nova-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial/99124d2//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 2m 21s
- gate-nova-specs-pep8-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/46/452546/1/check/gate-nova-specs-pep8-ubuntu-xenial/afbc529/ : SUCCESS in 1m 43s
- gate-nova-specs-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/46/452546/1/check/gate-nova-specs-python27-ubuntu-xenial/40a4646/ : SUCCESS in 3m 05s'}, {'account_id': 10224, 'date': '2017-04-02 17:05:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

There is another use case, which works now, basing on merging device by their specified names. I'm not against removing device names from API, but i'd like to keep it working."}, {'account_id': 10224, 'date': '2017-04-02 17:05:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-04-03 00:08:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10224, 'date': '2017-04-03 01:41:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-04-03 16:14:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9555, 'date': '2017-04-04 15:50:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Agree with Feodor this would remove an existing valid use case without replacement.

I think the only problem here is that we attempt to infer additional meaning from device_name, right? i.e. there's some implicit inference of bus and device order which isn't going to be honoured. If the device name is just a tag whose scope is an api request I think it continues to serve a useful purpose. That is: if the image and the api both refer to a device whose name is 'vda', then they're both the same thing, and there are no other defined semantics. We could equally have tagged it 'george'.

In general I don't like the idea of adding 'but_don't_do_X=True' flags, btw. I think we can define sane semantics for this without resorting to that."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-04-04 22:17:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> That is: if the image and the api both refer to a device whose name is 'vda', then they're both the same thing, and there are no other defined semantics. We could equally have tagged it 'george'.

I've been thinking more about this and I think given this use case (which I didn't know about since we don't test it and don't document it as such), before we can remove device from the API (at least for server create, I don't see how this matters for volume attach), we need two things in place:

1. Tagged bdm support on attach - which is Artom's blueprint here: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/virt-device-tagged-attach-detach

2. Expose bdm tags out of the REST API: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/393930/

#2 is getting held up on exposing VIF tags also out of the os-interface API so likely won't make Pike unless I can get os-interface sorted out in time (which probably means deprecating os-virtual-interface and combining that with os-interface so we can do the tag thing later).

--

But it raises the question, can't we remove device from the "POST /servers/{server_id}/os-volume_attachments" API? If I limited the scope to that would it help?'}, {'account_id': 10224, 'date': '2017-04-05 02:48:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Matt, Matthew, do you propose to use tags instead of device names? It might work, but what to do with existing image metadata, which contains device names? Do you propose to convert it in DB, moving device names to tags? Or Nova will analyze device names of image bdms, if the bdms do not contain tags?'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-04-05 13:12:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Matt, Matthew, do you propose to use tags instead of device names? It might work, but what to do with existing image metadata, which contains device names? Do you propose to convert it in DB, moving device names to tags? Or Nova will analyze device names of image bdms, if the bdms do not contain tags?

I think long-term yes we would use tags to correlate the BDMs for the override, however, there are several things that would need to be in place before we could do that: (1) we don't save the bdm.tag in the snapshot metadata today, (2) we don't yet have API support for attaching a volume and tagging the bdm during that operation - artom is working on that in pike, (3) we don't expose the tags out of the API yet on GET requests.

So at this point, trying to remove device_name from server create requests is not going to happen in Pike with almost a week left to spec freeze. I think we could probably drop device from the volume-attach API request since that's not doing any override.

Otherwise good progress for Pike for me would be to get a Tempest test merged that tests the override scenario, get artom's patches merged for tagged attach volume, and agreeing on a spec for queens to expose bdms in the API."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-04-05 13:13:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> and agreeing on a spec for queens to expose bdms in the API.

Sorry, agreeing on a spec for queens to expose bdm *tags* in the API.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-04-05 14:37:28.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

I'm going to drop this for Pike as it's just a distraction at this point. For Pike I'm going to try and get a Tempest test added for the image bdm override use case so we don't regress it, and try to get a plan put together for eventually exposing bdm tags out of the API so we can do that in Queens."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-03-21 00:05:59.000000000', 'content': 'Restored

This came up at the Rocky PTG:

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/nova-ptg-rocky

L575, so restoring it in case someone wants to work on it (dansmith?).'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-03-21 00:06:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-03-21 19:11:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-03-21 20:15:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Before I forget, this is the code that Feodor is talking about for merging and overriding image-defined BDMs, note the primary key here is the device_name:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/2ec8c49f6cb4a0e7dba217e824c20d9c703d2105/nova/compute/api.py#L670'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-03-21 20:26:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Before I forget, this is the code that Feodor is talking about for
 > merging and overriding image-defined BDMs, note the primary key
 > here is the device_name:
 > 
 > https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/2ec8c49f6cb4a0e7dba217e824c20d9c703d2105/nova/compute/api.py#L670

Yeah, so I think it's super weird that we ever did that. I wonder how widespread the use of it is.

Regardless, I would think that it would be reasonable to auto-tag image-supplied BDMs with something predictable like "image-bdm-vda" and then support the same merging behavior using tags instead of device names to allow overriding one from the boot command. I get the impression that documentation of this merging feature is a little skimpy, so we could do this predictable tag thing and then document it formally going forward. It's really unfortunate to not be able to remove the device name thing (which means something to people that we can't honor) just because it's used as a key right now.

Regardless, I think moving forward with removing the device name from the attach call is a large win, even if we can't eliminate device name from the BFV workflow.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-03-21 20:31:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Regardless, I would think that it would be reasonable to auto-tag image-supplied BDMs with something predictable like "image-bdm-vda" and then support the same merging behavior using tags instead of device names to allow overriding one from the boot command.

I haven't put a lot of thought into the auto-tag idea, but it's worth noting that image-defined BDMs don't need to specify a device_name either, since it's an optional parameter. It's just that a cloud would have to set arbitrary device names in the image-defined BDMs to allow the chance to even override them.

As for documentation about this 'feature' in the compute API, this is as close as I got:

https://docs.openstack.org/nova/pike/user/block-device-mapping.html#intermezzo-problem-with-device-names

"Currently (mid Liberty) users are discouraged from specifying device names for all calls requiring or allowing block device mapping, except when trying to override the image block device mapping on instance boot, and it will likely remain like that in the future."

> Regardless, I think moving forward with removing the device name from the attach call is a large win, even if we can't eliminate device name from the BFV workflow.

Agree, I think that would be a win. So we'd have a new microversion that:

1. Removes device_name from POST /os-volume_attachments.
2. Adds device tags to GET /os-volume_attachments (volume BDMs) and GET /os-interface (ports).

I could write that up as a separate spec.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-03-21 20:35:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I haven't put a lot of thought into the auto-tag idea, but it's
 > worth noting that image-defined BDMs don't need to specify a
 > device_name either, since it's an optional parameter. It's just
 > that a cloud would have to set arbitrary device names in the
 > image-defined BDMs to allow the chance to even override them.

Yep, so those wouldn't need auto-tagging anyway.

The other idea I forgot to mention is that if we were to remove the replacement/merging function, and assume that if you provide one BDM, you provide them all, it would be possible for the client (ec2api in this case) to inspect the image, extract and merge the BDMs as desired and provide them to the boot call. This would be more future-proof anyway, and I don't really see any compelling reason not to just iterate towards that goal."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-04 20:06:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-06-05 18:01:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

from an api standpoint, nothing leaps out as problematic. a suggestion within if you're feeling super complete"}, {'account_id': 6062, 'date': '2018-06-07 05:24:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-07 16:28:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 9373, 'date': '2018-09-20 08:16:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Before removing a device name from this requests I'd like to see an ability to specify a desirable volume device index, which could be honoured later, for example in [1] and [2]. Here using conf.device_addr.unit with conf.device_addr.target would allow having persistent volume ordering inside guest with virtio-scsi controller at least after hard reboots.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/stable/rocky/nova/virt/libvirt/volume/volume.py#L106
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/stable/rocky/nova/virt/libvirt/imagebackend.py#L166"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-09-25 13:59:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Before removing a device name from this requests I'd like to see an ability to specify a desirable volume device index, which could be honoured later, for example in [1] and [2]. Here using conf.device_addr.unit with conf.device_addr.target would allow having persistent volume ordering inside guest with virtio-scsi controller at least after hard reboots.

That sounds extremely specific to the libvirt driver and a specific configuration which we could not necessarily honor everywhere, right? That's the problem with the device_name parameter in the first place - the user can specify it but we can't honor it. We can pass through things like virtual device tags to the config drive and metadata API so the guest can order the devices on their side using the tags. I think mdbooth has some other ideas on persistent / stable device ordering so you might want to sync with him."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-23 21:09:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

As a simple way to move forward on part of this, with something I think we can all agree on, I'll propose a separate spec which just exposes the virtual device tags for volume attachments and ports, and leave the device_name removal for this spec which we can update later as necessary/wanted. We might also want to expose the boot_index out of the os-volume_attachments API along with the tags, but that could be discussed as part of that spec when I write it."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-26 21:22:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> As a simple way to move forward on part of this, with something I think we can all agree on, I'll propose a separate spec which just exposes the virtual device tags for volume attachments and ports, and leave the device_name removal for this spec which we can update later as necessary/wanted

Done: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/393930/"}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-10-29 08:54:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Should we merge this one with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/393930/?'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-11-06 15:07:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

> Should we merge this one with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/393930/ ?

No that is intentionally separated from this. I really need to WIP this since it's (1) targeted to Rocky still and (2) I'm not actively pursuing this - it would still need to be updated to remove the boot-from-volume parts because of the scenario ftersin described (and Dan and I discussed inline). We still need a tempest test for that scenario too...."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-04-15 16:29:34.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Abandoning this for the time being. We're exposing tags now:

https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/reference/api-microversion-history.html#id63

And boot_index will be exposed as part of blueprint detach-boot-volume."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-04-02 15:58:55.000000000', 'message': "Remove device from BDM POST requests (spec)

We have long talked about removing the ability to specify a block device name
when creating a server or attaching a volume because we can't honor the
requested device name anyway and trying to do so just causes issues.

This spec proposes to remove ``block_device_mapping.device_name`` (v1) and
``block_device_mapping_v2.device_name`` from the ``POST /servers`` (create)
API and ``device`` from the ``POST /servers/{server_id}/os-volume_attachments``
(attach volume) API.

APIImpact

Spec for blueprint remove-device-from-bdm-post-requests

Change-Id: I5a18ffd13f0b84748a89e20e0549cc060d746415
"}, {'created': '2018-06-04 20:06:21.000000000', 'message': 'Remove device from volume attach requests (spec)

We have long talked about removing the ability to specify a
block device name when attaching a volume because we cannot
honor the requested device name anyway and trying to do so
just causes issues.

This spec proposes to remove ``device`` from the
``POST /servers/{server_id}/os-volume_attachments``
(attach volume) API.

In addition, device tags for volumes and ports will be added
to the response bodies for the following APIs:

* POST /servers/{server_id}/os-volume_attachments
* GET /servers/{server_id}/os-volume_attachments
* GET /servers/{server_id}/os-volume_attachments/{volume_id}
* POST /servers/{server_id}/os-interface
* GET /servers/{server_id}/os-interface
* GET /servers/{server_id}/os-interface/{port_id}

APIImpact

Spec for blueprint remove-device-from-volume-attach-requests

Change-Id: I5a18ffd13f0b84748a89e20e0549cc060d746415
'}]
commit_message:
Remove device from volume attach requests (spec)

We have long talked about removing the ability to specify a
block device name when attaching a volume because we cannot
honor the requested device name anyway and trying to do so
just causes issues.

This spec proposes to remove ``device`` from the
``POST /servers/{server_id}/os-volume_attachments``
(attach volume) API.

In addition, device tags for volumes and ports will be added
to the response bodies for the following APIs:

* POST /servers/{server_id}/os-volume_attachments
* GET /servers/{server_id}/os-volume_attachments
* GET /servers/{server_id}/os-volume_attachments/{volume_id}
* POST /servers/{server_id}/os-interface
* GET /servers/{server_id}/os-interface
* GET /servers/{server_id}/os-interface/{port_id}

APIImpact

Spec for blueprint remove-device-from-volume-attach-requests

Change-Id: I5a18ffd13f0b84748a89e20e0549cc060d746415

commit_message:
Simplify & document unregister

1) Simplify the unregister task, which doesn't require any parameter,
   easier to maintain and less error prone.

2) Document with a playbook example in README how to unregister.

3) Remove useless register, never used later.

Change-Id: Ic1b6674c4608b555f51aa8c6716630c8d96b7fe2

subject: Stop stonith-enabled being incorrectly set false.
messages: [{'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2019-04-15 15:15:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2019-04-15 15:18:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2019-04-15 15:33:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2019-04-15 16:09:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-15 15:15:38.000000000', 'message': "Stop stonith-enabled being incorrectly set false.

Stonith is being disabled at the global cluster level despite it being needed
for pacemaker-remote nodes.

The legacy hacluster charm option 'stonith_enable' covers the main 'member'
nodes and if it is set to false then stonith resources are not created for
them and the stonith-enabled cluster parameter is set to false. However, in a
masakari deploy stonith is not required for the member nodes but is for the
remote nodes. In this case stonith-enabled cluster option should be set to
true.

Change-Id: Ie1affa17dd3cfcd677aa866b6e3d1c1004bb13c9
Closes-Bug: #1824828
"}]
commit_message:
Stop stonith-enabled being incorrectly set false.

Stonith is being disabled at the global cluster level despite it being needed
for pacemaker-remote nodes.

The legacy hacluster charm option 'stonith_enable' covers the main 'member'
nodes and if it is set to false then stonith resources are not created for
them and the stonith-enabled cluster parameter is set to false. However, in a
masakari deploy stonith is not required for the member nodes but is for the
remote nodes. In this case stonith-enabled cluster option should be set to
true.

Change-Id: Ie1affa17dd3cfcd677aa866b6e3d1c1004bb13c9
Closes-Bug: #1824828

commit_message:
DNM: run the linuxbridge job multinode to test live migration

This is needed to test a nova patch which is specific to linuxbridge
and live migration, which requires a multinode job.

This is basically the same config as neutron-tempest-multinode-full
except Q_AGENT=linuxbridge in the local.conf.

Related-Bug: #1786346

Change-Id: I8eb235261ccf8eea03f0a8454342efa2fc61ece3

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Idd858a3ebc775f19e689bf2954c80d85dca682e1

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I46b077f268d3a812e36f3de532ce1bfe7636166c

[{'created': '2018-12-20 00:10:20.000000000', 'message': "Update port device_owner when unshelving

When we shelve offload an instance, we unplug VIFs, delete
the guest from the compute host, etc. The instance is still
logically attached to its ports but they aren't connected
on any host.

When we unshelve an instance, it is scheduled and created
on a potentially new host, in a potentially new availability
zone. During unshelve, the compute manager will call the
setup_instance_network_on_host() method to update the port
host binding information for the new host, but was not
updating the device_owner, which reflects the availability
zone that the instance is in. Because of this, an instance
can be created in az1, shelved, and then unshelved in az2
but the port device_owner still says az1 even though the
port host binding is for a compute host in az2.

This change simply updates the port device_owner when
updating the port binding host during unshelve.

A TODO is left in the cleanup_instance_network_on_host()
method which is called during shelve offload but is currently
not implemented. We should unbind ports when shelve offloading,
but that is a bit of a bigger change and left for a separate
patch since it is not technically needed for this bug fix.

Change-Id: Ibd1cbe0e9b5cf3ede542dbf62b1a7d503ba7ea06
Closes-Bug: #1759924
(cherry picked from commit 93802619adde69bf84d26d7231480abb4da07c91)
(cherry picked from commit 3e38d1cf16ca29948be499aa37e2494ffd001f12)
(cherry picked from commit 245364ece1689853bf33ac25d7319618d064d909)
(cherry picked from commit c7bb9b1652b6df3e0a353a5c9f4cf70299c4e5e7)
"}]
commit_message:
Update port device_owner when unshelving

When we shelve offload an instance, we unplug VIFs, delete
the guest from the compute host, etc. The instance is still
logically attached to its ports but they aren't connected
on any host.

When we unshelve an instance, it is scheduled and created
on a potentially new host, in a potentially new availability
zone. During unshelve, the compute manager will call the
setup_instance_network_on_host() method to update the port
host binding information for the new host, but was not
updating the device_owner, which reflects the availability
zone that the instance is in. Because of this, an instance
can be created in az1, shelved, and then unshelved in az2
but the port device_owner still says az1 even though the
port host binding is for a compute host in az2.

This change simply updates the port device_owner when
updating the port binding host during unshelve.

A TODO is left in the cleanup_instance_network_on_host()
method which is called during shelve offload but is currently
not implemented. We should unbind ports when shelve offloading,
but that is a bit of a bigger change and left for a separate
patch since it is not technically needed for this bug fix.

Change-Id: Ibd1cbe0e9b5cf3ede542dbf62b1a7d503ba7ea06
Closes-Bug: #1759924
(cherry picked from commit 93802619adde69bf84d26d7231480abb4da07c91)
(cherry picked from commit 3e38d1cf16ca29948be499aa37e2494ffd001f12)
(cherry picked from commit 245364ece1689853bf33ac25d7319618d064d909)
(cherry picked from commit c7bb9b1652b6df3e0a353a5c9f4cf70299c4e5e7)

subject: Add per-cycle Python job templates
messages:
[{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-02-19 14:58:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-02-19 15:00:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Not sure if we also want to explicitly declare nodeset tags as well so stable branches using this template always run on the distro version for that release cycle.'}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2019-02-19 15:58:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

This approach makes sense to me.

Thanks!
Jay'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2019-02-19 16:02:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

This is a great effort towards keeping consistency between all projects and also better than landing individual patches in each repo for every python version upgrade.
Thanks Sean!'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-02-19 16:18:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-02-19 22:21:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

We already passed a TC resolution defining how this would work:  https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20181024-python-update-process.html
It would be better if we follow that rather than make up a new way that's inconsistent with the thing we just agreed upon.

What we decided was to have templates for the python3 jobs only, named e.g. openstack-python3-stein-jobs. I think that gives more flexibility for projects to make use of the jobs, but if we now think that's wrong then we should update the resolution rather than let practice diverge from documentation."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-02-25 17:43:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks Zane, I had actually forgotten we did that.

Reading that now, there's a few things I'm not too happy about in that resolution. I do kind of like this approach of having a cycle-based job defined for all Python versions, not just Python 3. But I can't really pursue amending that resolution at this point, so I guess we can see how that goes for Train and then decide if it needs any changes."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-02-25 17:43:33.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-02-27 16:44:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

You did vote for it ;)

https://review.openstack.org/613145'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-02-27 16:50:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yeah, I think I was just happy to see something being done about all this. :)'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-04-15 16:02:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-19 14:58:36.000000000', 'message': "Add per-cycle Python job templates

Our policy is to use the version of Python that comes packaged with the
LTS versions of distros at the start of development cycles. This hasn't
always been clear to projects, and in general we haven't done a great
job of making sure the correct tests are being run.

This adds job templates with the required python versioned jobs for each
cycle to make it explicit. We are a little late in Stein, but projects
may choose to pick up the use of the Stein template yet to make
branching easier.

We have some automation in place when creating stable branches. We will
look into automating the switch over to the Train required jobs when we
cut the stable/stein branches.

Change-Id: Idafa76f48181e41a90b4d88d8342638340345e93
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Add per-cycle Python job templates

Our policy is to use the version of Python that comes packaged with the
LTS versions of distros at the start of development cycles. This hasn't
always been clear to projects, and in general we haven't done a great
job of making sure the correct tests are being run.

This adds job templates with the required python versioned jobs for each
cycle to make it explicit. We are a little late in Stein, but projects
may choose to pick up the use of the Stein template yet to make
branching easier.

We have some automation in place when creating stable branches. We will
look into automating the switch over to the Train required jobs when we
cut the stable/stein branches.

Change-Id: Idafa76f48181e41a90b4d88d8342638340345e93
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ib98234606e1625c4e99853ae46787217ec1beaa7

subject: Not implicitly set vol_device_name to vda
messages: [{'account_id': 20944, 'date': '2019-04-01 13:45:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 20944, 'date': '2019-04-01 14:08:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-04-09 13:47:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2\n\nLooks good, but we need to wait until rocky and queen backports land.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2019-04-15 15:25:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-01 13:45:31.000000000', 'message': "Not implicitly set vol_device_name to vda

Using a scsi decorated image with:
hw_disk_bus='scsi'
hw_scsi_model='virtio-scsi'

This solve the case where an instance is
launched with 'image' selected as boot
source with a new volume. This will result
in /dev/vda instead of /dev/sda as it
should.

Not specifying device name in
setFinalSpecBootImageToVolume() leaves the
decision to nova to determine it.

Example:
-------
VM boot volume without scsi meta data decoration:
Attached To
0a0cd660-7ce3-4033-9983-2e1099edc5f0 on /dev/vda

VM boot volume with scsi meta data decoration:
Attached To
91f50dbc-8bdf-4293-84ea-fc5df27b5ee4 on /dev/sda
--------

Note: This commit doesn't address cases for
where instances are launched using existing
volume and snapshot, this will involve more
work to migrate the code from BDMv1 to BDMv2.

Closes-Bug #1560965

Change-Id: I9d114c2c2e6736a8f1a8092afa568f930b656f09
(cherry picked from commit 4788c4d2f59b8aa08e5f599a6d2c327b6004dc0c)
"}, {'created': '2019-04-01 14:08:36.000000000', 'message': "Not implicitly set vol_device_name to vda

hw_disk_bus='scsi'
hw_scsi_model='virtio-scsi'

91f50dbc-8bdf-4293-84ea-fc5df27b5ee4 on /dev/sda
--------

Change-Id: I9d114c2c2e6736a8f1a8092afa568f930b656f09
(cherry picked from commit 0df60f4dba64e45486d9ef4ea5a24e0ee4f05355)
"}]
commit_message:
Not implicitly set vol_device_name to vda

Using a scsi decorated image with:
hw_disk_bus='scsi'
hw_scsi_model='virtio-scsi'

This solve the case where an instance is
launched with 'image' selected as boot
source with a new volume. This will result
in /dev/vda instead of /dev/sda as it
should.

Not specifying device name in
setFinalSpecBootImageToVolume() leaves the
decision to nova to determine it.

Example:
-------
VM boot volume without scsi meta data decoration:
Attached To
0a0cd660-7ce3-4033-9983-2e1099edc5f0 on /dev/vda

VM boot volume with scsi meta data decoration:
Attached To
91f50dbc-8bdf-4293-84ea-fc5df27b5ee4 on /dev/sda
--------

Note: This commit doesn't address cases for
where instances are launched using existing
volume and snapshot, this will involve more
work to migrate the code from BDMv1 to BDMv2.

Closes-Bug #1560965

Change-Id: I9d114c2c2e6736a8f1a8092afa568f930b656f09
(cherry picked from commit 0df60f4dba64e45486d9ef4ea5a24e0ee4f05355)

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: Ib1c5f2f6740d4c227ce5493afa545b62ff1f3c45

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-10 12:35:59.000000000', 'message': 'Switch from oslosphinx to openstackdocstheme

The oslosphinx package is not compatible with the current Sphinx 2.0
release. Migration has been happening to openstackdocstheme for some
time. To fix build failures for docs and releasenotes jobs, this
switches masakari jobs to use openstackdocstheme.

Change-Id: Ic74e8b075aa67d410617dac3346bf1c903995da7
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-04-10 12:55:19.000000000', 'message': 'Switch from oslosphinx to openstackdocstheme

release. Migration has been happening to openstackdocstheme for some
time. To fix build failures for docs and releasenotes jobs, this
switches masakari jobs to use openstackdocstheme.

Uncapping jsonschema to pass requirements check so it matches global
requirements.

Change-Id: Ic74e8b075aa67d410617dac3346bf1c903995da7
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Switch from oslosphinx to openstackdocstheme

The oslosphinx package is not compatible with the current Sphinx 2.0
release. Migration has been happening to openstackdocstheme for some
time. To fix build failures for docs and releasenotes jobs, this
switches masakari jobs to use openstackdocstheme.

Uncapping jsonschema to pass requirements check so it matches global
requirements.

Change-Id: Ic74e8b075aa67d410617dac3346bf1c903995da7
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add openstack_release and openstack_branch

Adds two new variables, 'openstack_release' and 'openstack_branch',
in ${KAYOBE_CONFIG_PATH}/openstack.yml for setting the current OpenStack
release and branch in a single place.

Also uses the master branch for the molecule tox job.

Change-Id: I851a1e6eddc6738005c1813599445b38c0ae0d57

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I02835ef17678619ceab816291cc8249a4b555a18

[{'created': '2019-04-01 13:42:32.000000000', 'message': "Not implicitly set vol_device_name to vda

Using a scsi decorated image with:
hw_disk_bus='scsi'
hw_scsi_model='virtio-scsi'

This solve the case where an instance is
launched with 'image' selected as boot
source with a new volume. This will result
in /dev/vda instead of /dev/sda as it
should.

Not specifying device name in
setFinalSpecBootImageToVolume() leaves the
decision to nova to determine it.

Example:
-------
VM boot volume without scsi meta data decoration:
Attached To
0a0cd660-7ce3-4033-9983-2e1099edc5f0 on /dev/vda

VM boot volume with scsi meta data decoration:
Attached To
91f50dbc-8bdf-4293-84ea-fc5df27b5ee4 on /dev/sda
--------

Note: This commit doesn't address cases for
where instances are launched using existing
volume and snapshot, this will involve more
work to migrate the code from BDMv1 to BDMv2.

Closes-Bug #1560965

Change-Id: I9d114c2c2e6736a8f1a8092afa568f930b656f09
(cherry picked from commit 4788c4d2f59b8aa08e5f599a6d2c327b6004dc0c)

commit_message:
Not implicitly set vol_device_name to vda

Using a scsi decorated image with:
hw_disk_bus='scsi'
hw_scsi_model='virtio-scsi'

This solve the case where an instance is
launched with 'image' selected as boot
source with a new volume. This will result
in /dev/vda instead of /dev/sda as it
should.

Not specifying device name in
setFinalSpecBootImageToVolume() leaves the
decision to nova to determine it.

Example:
-------
VM boot volume without scsi meta data decoration:
Attached To
0a0cd660-7ce3-4033-9983-2e1099edc5f0 on /dev/vda

VM boot volume with scsi meta data decoration:
Attached To
91f50dbc-8bdf-4293-84ea-fc5df27b5ee4 on /dev/sda
--------

Note: This commit doesn't address cases for
where instances are launched using existing
volume and snapshot, this will involve more
work to migrate the code from BDMv1 to BDMv2.

Closes-Bug #1560965

Change-Id: I9d114c2c2e6736a8f1a8092afa568f930b656f09
(cherry picked from commit 79a4c3bd1aac1473f0d524d98c4cb96475cde498)

commit_message:
Fix incompatible version handling in BuildRequest

The BuildRequest object code assumed that IncompatibleObjectVersion
exception has a objver field that contains the object version. This
assumption is not true. The unit test made another mistake serializing
the function object obj_to_primitive instead of serializing the result
of the call of obj_to_primitive. This caused a false positive test
covering the error in the implementation as well.

Conflicts:
    nova/objects/build_request.py

Note(elod.illes): conflict is due to not having patch
Ie3a83fef0dc689b9d37ac43e047ce5d48f567adc on stable/pike.

Closes-Bug: #1812177

Change-Id: I1ef4a23aa2bf5cb46b481045f3d968f62f74606d
(cherry picked from commit 975f0156137e37f7a9139c0268547d79dcc3c43c)
(cherry picked from commit 6061186d2d86eb628dcdc61667c240576fa8f10e)
(cherry picked from commit 7c85ebad0bf13d609b384e7637b0787bf8d484f7)

commit_message:
Use IP supplied via relation for pacmaker remotes

When setting up resources for pacemaker remote nodes use the IP
address supplied by the remote node for communication. This
ensures that communication happens over the desired network
space.

Depends-On: I5aa6993ec702f97403d1a659e09a3fb2f5af4202
Change-Id: I9bb20b5f0b0d780fbf4cc0ac0e5f86fe277c4715
Closes-Bug: #1824514

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-20 06:25:41.000000000', 'message': "Pass `flush_on_reconnect` to memcache backends by default

If a memcache server disappears and then reconnects when multiple memcache
servers are used (specific to the python-memcached based backends) it is
possible that the server will contain stale data. The default is now to
supply the ``flush_on_reconnect`` optional argument to the backend. This
means that when the service connects to a memcache server, it will flush
all cached data in the server.

See the help from python-memcached:

	@param flush_on_reconnect: optional flag which prevents a
	    scenario that can cause stale data to be read: If there's more
	    than one memcached server and the connection to one is
	    interrupted, keys that mapped to that server will get
	    reassigned to another. If the first server comes back, those
	    keys will map to it again. If it still has its data, get()s
	    can read stale data that was overwritten on another
	    server. This flag is off by default for backwards
	    compatibility.

Change-Id: I3e335261f749ad065e8abe972f4ac476d334e6b3
closes-bug: #1819957
"}, {'created': '2019-03-22 19:37:45.000000000', 'message': "Pass `flush_on_reconnect` to memcache pooled backend

If a memcache server disappears and then reconnects when multiple memcache
servers are used (specific to the python-memcached based backends) it is
possible that the server will contain stale data. The default is now to
supply the ``flush_on_reconnect`` optional argument to the backend. This
means that when the service connects to a memcache server, it will flush
all cached data in the server. The pooled backend is more likely to
run into issues with this as it does not explicitly use a thread.local
for the client. The non-pooled backend was not touched, it is not
the recommended production use-case.

See the help from python-memcached:

    @param flush_on_reconnect: optional flag which prevents a
	scenario that can cause stale data to be read: If there's more
	than one memcached server and the connection to one is
	interrupted, keys that mapped to that server will get
	reassigned to another. If the first server comes back, those
	keys will map to it again. If it still has its data, get()s
	can read stale data that was overwritten on another
	server. This flag is off by default for backwards
	compatibility.

Change-Id: I3e335261f749ad065e8abe972f4ac476d334e6b3
closes-bug: #1819957
"}]
commit_message:
Pass `flush_on_reconnect` to memcache pooled backend

If a memcache server disappears and then reconnects when multiple memcache
servers are used (specific to the python-memcached based backends) it is
possible that the server will contain stale data. The default is now to
supply the ``flush_on_reconnect`` optional argument to the backend. This
means that when the service connects to a memcache server, it will flush
all cached data in the server. The pooled backend is more likely to
run into issues with this as it does not explicitly use a thread.local
for the client. The non-pooled backend was not touched, it is not
the recommended production use-case.

See the help from python-memcached:

    @param flush_on_reconnect: optional flag which prevents a
	scenario that can cause stale data to be read: If there's more
	than one memcached server and the connection to one is
	interrupted, keys that mapped to that server will get
	reassigned to another. If the first server comes back, those
	keys will map to it again. If it still has its data, get()s
	can read stale data that was overwritten on another
	server. This flag is off by default for backwards
	compatibility.

Change-Id: I3e335261f749ad065e8abe972f4ac476d334e6b3
closes-bug: #1819957

commit_message:
Replace usage of netloc filters to urlsplit

Removed the reference to netloc_no_port as it will
be taken out from openstack-ansible-plugins.

Related-Bug: #1820830

Now using ansible 2.4's urlsplit filter as a replacement.

Change-Id: I233bfa35dde928a2d93ff1d30787396baa8efcf5

commit_message:
Apply cookiecutter on collect-logs

It adds all the requires files for ansible-role-collect-logs
in order to consume it as a role.

It also moves README.md to README.rst
Added pre-commit and removes ansible-lint.sh.

https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/890

Change-Id: I259f148e03c09e27edfb1bcc251cc62f0f1f59e9
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove ctlplane data from CI network-environment

The change this depends on and the changes before
it remove the need to provide these parameters as
they are instead read from the subnet.

Depends-On: I5f33e06ca3f4b13cc355e02156edd9d8a1f773cd
Change-Id: I64ffeae8ead85af9aebc2e546b47d175a5a0eea7

Fixes problem in is_boss_controller function

We need to make sure we check model name of controller
starts with "BOSS"

Change-Id: I0b8608bad4ffc1f6c5bcf5ae36d9c0c76478260b
(cherry picked from commit 5ec4f3dc1f2a661257b1b1468ea11c8400a34bc2)

recheck'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-04-03 14:41:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20:

It seems that the failures in bare metal deployment are due to iptables not forwarding packets across breth1. Testing locally, this can be worked around by setting the following sysctl:

net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-iptables=0

This was tried in dev/functions, but it gets set to 1 by kolla-ansible so this didn't work on its own.

An alternative approach of disabling the ironic inspector iptables PXE filter worked as a workaround in CI.

It's not clear why this has suddenly stopped working in Stein. I can't see any relevant changes in the generated iptables rules, and that sysctl option has been set for some time.

The only change I can see in iptables is the default action in the FORWARD filter chain:

*filter
:FORWARD DROP [16:6784]

It's not clear why this has changed."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-04-03 14:46:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20:

> It seems that the failures in bare metal deployment are due to
 > iptables not forwarding packets across breth1. Testing locally,
 > this can be worked around by setting the following sysctl:
 > 
 > net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-iptables=0
 > 
 > This was tried in dev/functions, but it gets set to 1 by
 > kolla-ansible so this didn't work on its own.
 > 
 > An alternative approach of disabling the ironic inspector iptables
 > PXE filter worked as a workaround in CI.
 > 
 > It's not clear why this has suddenly stopped working in Stein. I
 > can't see any relevant changes in the generated iptables rules, and
 > that sysctl option has been set for some time.
 > 
 > The only change I can see in iptables is the default action in the
 > FORWARD filter chain:
 > 
 > *filter
 > :FORWARD DROP [16:6784]
 > 
 > It's not clear why this has changed.

It looks like Docker CE is the culprit: https://docs.docker.com/v17.09/engine/userguide/networking/default_network/container-communication/#container-communication-between-hosts.

It's not clear why disabling the ironic inspector iptables PXE filter makes this issue disappear though."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-04-09 12:56:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 21.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-04-09 16:55:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-04-09 16:57:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22: Workflow-1

Finally, the overcloud deploy job is working. Now bifrost has broken the seed jobs by making RabbitMQ not the default message bus (JSON-RPC is instead).

We need https://review.openstack.org/#/c/651257/ to land in Bifrost.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-04-10 07:33:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-04-10 07:33:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-04-10 09:22:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22:

Finally working, ready for reviews'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-04-10 10:07:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28048, 'date': '2019-04-12 13:07:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2019-04-12 18:06:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-04-15 11:39:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-04-15 11:40:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22:

The dependent kolla-ansible patch has now merged. Will that trigger a gate run for this one?'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-04-15 12:20:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-04-15 12:20:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22:

That seems to have done it.'}]

commit_message:
Use master version of dependencies

Use master branch of:

* Kolla
* Kolla ansible
* Bifrost
* IPA
* OpenStack services
* Requirements

Also, use the infra docker registry mirror at port 8082 which does not
have any path component in its URL, and so works with Docker CE.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/651254/
Change-Id: Icdb62aa0083d9272a08421138719cf5f6b52ec5a
Story: 2001864
Task: 14316

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-17 02:29:33.000000000', 'message': "Fix disk size during live migration with disk over-commit

Prior to microversion 2.25, the migration api supported a
'disk_over_commit' parameter, which indicated that we should do disk
size check on the destination host taking into account disk
over-commit. Versions since 2.25 no longer have this parameter, but we
continue to support the older microversion.

This disk size check was broken when disk over commit was in use on
the host. In LibvirtDriver._assert_dest_node_has_enough_disk() we
correctly calculate the required space using allocated disk size
rather than virtual disk size when doing an over-committed check.
However, we were checking against 'disk_available_least' as reported
by the destination host. This value is: the amount of disk space which
the host would have if all instances fully allocated their storage. On
an over-committed host it will therefore be negative, despite there
actually being space on the destination host.

The check we actually want to do for disk over commit is: does the
target host have enough free space to take the allocated size of this
instance's disks? We leave checking over-allocation ratios to the
scheduler. Note that if we use disk_available_least here and the
destination host is over-allocated, this will always fail because free
space will be negative, even though we're explicitly ok with that.

Using disk_available_least would make sense for the non-overcommit
case, where the test would be: would the target host have enough free
space for this instance if the instance fully allocated all its
storage, and everything else on the target also fully allocated its
storage? As noted, we no longer actually run that test, though.

We fix the issue for legacy microversions by fixing the destination
host's reported disk space according to the given disk_over_commit
parameter.

Change-Id: I8a705114d47384fcd00955d4a4f204072fed57c2
Resolves-bug: #1708572
(cherry picked from commit e097c001c8e11110efe8879da57264fcb7bdfdf2)
Signed-off-by: Zhang Hua <joshua.zhang@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Refix disk size during live migration with disk over-commit

Currently available disk of targer host is calculated based on
local_gb, not available disk(free_disk_gb). This check can be
negative if the target host has no free disk.

Change-Id: Iec50269ef31dfe090f0cd4db95a37909661bd910
closes-bug: 1744079
(cherry picked from commit e2cc275063658b23ed88824100919a6dfccb760d)
Signed-off-by: Zhang Hua <joshua.zhang@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Fix disk size during live migration with disk over-commit

Prior to microversion 2.25, the migration api supported a
'disk_over_commit' parameter, which indicated that we should do disk
size check on the destination host taking into account disk
over-commit. Versions since 2.25 no longer have this parameter, but we
continue to support the older microversion.

This disk size check was broken when disk over commit was in use on
the host. In LibvirtDriver._assert_dest_node_has_enough_disk() we
correctly calculate the required space using allocated disk size
rather than virtual disk size when doing an over-committed check.
However, we were checking against 'disk_available_least' as reported
by the destination host. This value is: the amount of disk space which
the host would have if all instances fully allocated their storage. On
an over-committed host it will therefore be negative, despite there
actually being space on the destination host.

The check we actually want to do for disk over commit is: does the
target host have enough free space to take the allocated size of this
instance's disks? We leave checking over-allocation ratios to the
scheduler. Note that if we use disk_available_least here and the
destination host is over-allocated, this will always fail because free
space will be negative, even though we're explicitly ok with that.

Using disk_available_least would make sense for the non-overcommit
case, where the test would be: would the target host have enough free
space for this instance if the instance fully allocated all its
storage, and everything else on the target also fully allocated its
storage? As noted, we no longer actually run that test, though.

We fix the issue for legacy microversions by fixing the destination
host's reported disk space according to the given disk_over_commit
parameter.

Change-Id: I8a705114d47384fcd00955d4a4f204072fed57c2
Resolves-bug: #1708572
(cherry picked from commit e097c001c8e11110efe8879da57264fcb7bdfdf2)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-07 16:44:43.000000000', 'message': 'Resolve SAWarning in Query.soft_delete()

We currently see a lot of warnings like this from
the soft_delete() method:

  sqlalchemy.exc.SAWarning: Evaluating non-mapped column expression
  'updated_at' onto ORM instances; this is a deprecated use case.
  Please make use of the actual mapped columns in ORM-evaluated
  UPDATE / DELETE expressions.

This is because the "evaluate" synchronization strategy would like
to search for objects and update them based on the UPDATE criteria
passed, however the columns given, literal_column('id'),
literal_column('updated_at'), are not mapped to anything. The
evaluator has to make a guess that the string contained in these
expressions should be matched to a mapped attribute on the given
entity and this guess was first removed in [1], then added back in
[2] with a warning (likely since oslo.db is invoking it).

This uses the actual entity-mapped column for the query rather
than the literal string column.

[1] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/latest/changelog/changelog_12.html#change-b1e620dece39006ab44c47044e9a6fee
[2] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/latest/changelog/changelog_12.html#change-dff3a469788c81a46440584406cb22be

Change-Id: I192e84ce757d12d33085a209dd58d8ea46fb90fb
Closes-Bug: #1814199
(cherry picked from commit af4b2263e4852de2bd4e66848a18be4d2282bacc)
(cherry picked from commit ddc4129a6dfdc16296d16e052c882717a4125611)
'}]
commit_message:
Resolve SAWarning in Query.soft_delete()

We currently see a lot of warnings like this from
the soft_delete() method:

  sqlalchemy.exc.SAWarning: Evaluating non-mapped column expression
  'updated_at' onto ORM instances; this is a deprecated use case.
  Please make use of the actual mapped columns in ORM-evaluated
  UPDATE / DELETE expressions.

This is because the "evaluate" synchronization strategy would like
to search for objects and update them based on the UPDATE criteria
passed, however the columns given, literal_column('id'),
literal_column('updated_at'), are not mapped to anything. The
evaluator has to make a guess that the string contained in these
expressions should be matched to a mapped attribute on the given
entity and this guess was first removed in [1], then added back in
[2] with a warning (likely since oslo.db is invoking it).

This uses the actual entity-mapped column for the query rather
than the literal string column.

[1] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/latest/changelog/changelog_12.html#change-b1e620dece39006ab44c47044e9a6fee
[2] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/latest/changelog/changelog_12.html#change-dff3a469788c81a46440584406cb22be

Change-Id: I192e84ce757d12d33085a209dd58d8ea46fb90fb
Closes-Bug: #1814199
(cherry picked from commit af4b2263e4852de2bd4e66848a18be4d2282bacc)
(cherry picked from commit ddc4129a6dfdc16296d16e052c882717a4125611)

commit_message:
Remove python3.5 jobs for Train

The TC has decided that python 3.5 tests are not required for Train
forward[1]. This patch removes the python 3.5 jobs from octavia-lib.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/ \
    005097.html

Change-Id: Ice875dde4eeb82962f3c635cb312f157d9a8331a

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I766b626071bd122951f731ff9acf91685424a6d9

commit_message:
Removing obsolete oslosphinx

Removing oslosphinx from docs requirements.
If any extensions is needed for building docs we should rely on
the openstackdocstheme or directly on sphinx modules.

commit_message:
Specify the IP address for cluster communication

Specify the IP address that cluster communication should happen on,
this is derived from the network space being used for the
pacemaker-remote relation.

Depends-On: I92b3f2644c7bee4e55463ffaae2769c33458dd16
Change-Id: I5aa6993ec702f97403d1a659e09a3fb2f5af4202
Closes-Bug: #1824514

commit_message:
debian: add support

This patch adds support for this role to be able to deploy on
Debian Stretch.

Change-Id: I97bcfacc55b8afcda6792dd19e7f947cdec38ce4
Needed-By: I9a92b73c419a0dc1cca40dacfef75de61a61db94

commit_message:
witch python3 versions of test jobs to match Train PTI

In Train, we will use python 3.6 and 3.7 for python3 runtime
in our gate jobs [1]. This commit drops python 3.5 and adds python 3.7.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I9628ad9293ea8ccae7d39af564b6713e60d0d4b5

commit_message:
Design Doc: Distributed OVSDB events

This patch introduces a design document highlighting the problem a
proposing a solution for the way OVSDB events are currently handled in
networking-ovn.

Related-Bug: #1823715
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: Iaef50bda2e67e114cec3fe6e147a61283c8c1003

Given the base of this series will ensure we pick the last tagged release as the target for the -em tag we will skip some commits.

Looking at cinder as an example:

 [tony@thor cinder]$ git log --oneline --no-merges 10.0.8..origin/stable/ocata
 cce47a4c2 VNX Driver: delete_hba() instead of remove_hba()
 b1a0d62f3 RBD: Don't query Ceph on stats for exclusive pools
 fae276f0d Fix for auth version change in Brcd HTTP
 9773f963f [Unity] Add support of removing empty host
 034feb6d7 ScaleIO Driver - adding cache and refactoring tests
 e704e8340 Unity: fail to detach lun when auto zone enabled
 9dbcb24f0 [Unity] Add `force detach` support
 346671c9b Unity driver: check array OE version
 39f1f020f [VNX]Add `force detach` support
 5be96ca9c Empty option value maybe cause Unity driver failed to initialize
 b7490b764 VMAX Ocata - a backport caused a deadlock

All of which are after we weer supposed to make this tag.  I'm kinda on the fence for ocata as we're correcting my oversight but I'd like to think carefully given we're about to do just this for pike"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-04-08 13:13:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2019-04-08 15:41:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Manila and Nova have already the EM tag.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-04-08 15:51:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Tag stable/ocata as extended maintenance

According to our extended maintenance documentation [0], we stated at
the start of the extended maintenance phase the "HEAD of the
appropriate branch will be tagged as $series-em", however, we did not
apply these tags to stable/ocata at the time. This adds ocata-em tags to
the ocata deliverables.

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#extended-maintenance

Change-Id: Ibac7f787950bf23e9a75fce37a6b82ec45d7df89
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Enable scenario 10 (octavia) for some stable branches

The octavia multinode job wasn't enabled for recent (and not so recent
stable branches). This rectifies that so some CI occurs on backports.

Change-Id: Ibea0bd528c87630f2888916cf5f2d99b15865a30

[{'created': '2019-04-12 10:35:19.000000000', 'message': "Make sure we always requests JSON responses

This patch updates the client to make sure we are always requesting
JSON format responses. The osc_lib does not request JSON by default
for API calls.
If we don't request JSON responses, the Octavia API can return HTML
formated responses.

Change-Id: I7f64d0c1c74b67ab1097d00282e55b9ba1a4f5a7
Story: 2004283
Task: 27833
(cherry picked from commit 14875d44d45d24527f2c92ca770759b798e189ea)
"}]
commit_message:
Make sure we always requests JSON responses

This patch updates the client to make sure we are always requesting
JSON format responses. The osc_lib does not request JSON by default
for API calls.
If we don't request JSON responses, the Octavia API can return HTML
formated responses.

Change-Id: I7f64d0c1c74b67ab1097d00282e55b9ba1a4f5a7
Story: 2004283
Task: 27833
(cherry picked from commit 14875d44d45d24527f2c92ca770759b798e189ea)

commit_message:
Disable curl globbing

Disable curl globbing to allow Swift ringbuilder to upload to IPv6
upload addresses. Also dicable globbing in the other places curl
is used.

Change-Id: Iba51cc75bea26b775f790849f0b466a6528ee627

[{'created': '2019-04-14 23:11:12.000000000', 'message': 'Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I449af10676f087ec75d2ca014045e33dc2a0fa4b

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-15 12:14:03.000000000', 'message': 'Add Python Jira module to requirements

The Jira module is now available in global-requirements:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562151/

Since the Jira module is now loaded by default, it always
needs to be installed. If a future change prevents loading
of the Jira module unless the Jira plugin is enabled then
this change can be reverted.

Change-Id: I3fea82e681cd49aab5cd6afc29c60302af7b63b7
Story: 2005400
Task: 30394
(cherry picked from commit 77328b74f4d00df20c3ca26dcf965d31a3f0c60b)
'}]
commit_message:
Add Python Jira module to requirements

The Jira module is now available in global-requirements:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562151/

Since the Jira module is now loaded by default, it always
needs to be installed. If a future change prevents loading
of the Jira module unless the Jira plugin is enabled then
this change can be reverted.

Change-Id: I3fea82e681cd49aab5cd6afc29c60302af7b63b7
Story: 2005400
Task: 30394
(cherry picked from commit 77328b74f4d00df20c3ca26dcf965d31a3f0c60b)

commit_message:
Add reply-to to std.email

Reply to address is useful when sending email from an unmonitored email
address and to give user a place to respond in order to contact us.

Add Reply-to as described in section 3.6.2 of RFC5222
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5322#section-3.6.2

Change-Id: Ib6b2bdc130e4f9e5170eb88760d69c3e08d2a1c7

commit_message:
Ensure venv_wheel_build_enable is evaluated as boolean

We use the bool filter to make sure that venv_wheel_build_enable
is evaluated as a boolean, rather than a string or something else.

Change-Id: Ice305d2239e55be7e1a6f30628b72cf442553fd5
(cherry picked from commit 130b101bdeaa2582007c13d39c2f9270a813030a)

commit_message:
Add trove_service_net_setup to aio deploy

Since we are using integrated tests, the services
overrides for role tests are not applied, which causes
trove to fail.

Change-Id: I6ba46a631e7a8f191159908bd6fd229dae4b1742
(cherry picked from commit 245d6317f3e55b0c6b362004e3e08138e8803d76)

commit_message:
Fix share replica details page for non-admins

Non-administrators cannot access share instance
export locations by the virtue of default policy.

Fix this retrieval to not error-out showing the
whole page.

Change-Id: I5f78e7fbfbf4ce93f9c1658609f20f179c6995a6
Closes-Bug: #1787016
(cherry picked from commit 8aa099315403381c5c3bb32415d5ba5d8e518a4d)
(cherry picked from commit 4ce060cf725210e895c7b1567c1c6a4928db44ee)

commit_message:
Don't show host field in project tables

We already suppress this information in non-admin contexts in
manila itself [1] so drop the field from the project view
tables.

Closes-Bug: #1664370
[1] I799bb7378927b6c3ee0f9fe88fd9876a03dd85b5

Change-Id: I00b99b082a4188e0e95c7a055da0fa28c5541338
(cherry picked from commit ad27411eb416202468cd3f937d02a0e68f4ffeb5)
(cherry picked from commit 97441440e098d06166299e811504fe26eb3b16aa)

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I253435d809bb40cc5ca9f72dcb98a04be293e1a6

commit_message:
Add Python Jira module to requirements

The Jira module is now available in global-requirements:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562151/

Since the Jira module is now loaded by default, it always
needs to be installed. If a future change prevents loading
of the Jira module unless the Jira plugin is enabled then
this change can be reverted.

Change-Id: I3fea82e681cd49aab5cd6afc29c60302af7b63b7
Story: 2005400
Task: 30394

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-10 16:54:28.000000000', 'message': "Version check: update using project name or tarball name

The current code worked only if the project was using the project_name
in kolla/common/config.py, rather than the tarball_base name. This is
only true on master - on stable branches we may switch to use the
tarball_base name, so the regex won't match.

Change-Id: I839649e6ef662ae3ff320edb3106da818956d26d
"}]
commit_message:
Version check: update using project name or tarball name

The current code worked only if the project was using the project_name
in kolla/common/config.py, rather than the tarball_base name. This is
only true on master - on stable branches we may switch to use the
tarball_base name, so the regex won't match.

Change-Id: I839649e6ef662ae3ff320edb3106da818956d26d

With large number of OSDs, where each OSD need a connection, the default
nofile (1024) of nova_compute is too small. This changes the default
DockerNovaComputeUlimit to 131072 what is the same for cinder.

Change-Id: Id19da6e8b7bfbe0e47b191e92c08fc34d1853a63
'}]
commit_message:
Increase DockerNovaComputeUlimit default value

With large number of OSDs, where each OSD need a connection, the default
nofile (1024) of nova_compute is too small. This changes the default
DockerNovaComputeUlimit to 131072 what is the same for cinder.

Change-Id: Id19da6e8b7bfbe0e47b191e92c08fc34d1853a63

commit_message:
Ansible module: fix clean error handling

It should not be up to the driver to handle the error. The error should
reach the manager. Moreover, handling the error in the driver and
returning nothing caused the manager to consider the step done and go to
the next one instead of interrupting the cleaning workflow

Change-Id: I3825838b5507bc735d983466aa3cac0edd4dfaca
Story: #2005357
Task: #30315
