We had no unit test coverage for the console-log command
so this adds a simple test. It unfortunately does not
recreate the original UnicodeEncodeError bug though, but
it gives us some test coverage anyway.

This change also adds docs on how to resolve bug 1746534
by configuring the environment for UTF-8 as noted in
the revert change Iaeec1e74262a35f3de3c81f7013835a6aa6f9029.

The documentation added here is shamelessly copied from
Click [1] which was found via the PEP 538 docs [2].

[1] https://click.palletsprojects.com/en/5.x/python3/#python-3-surrogate-handling
[2] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0538/

Related-Bug: #1823287

commit_message:
Add test for console-log and docs for bug 1746534

We had no unit test coverage for the console-log command
so this adds a simple test. It unfortunately does not
recreate the original UnicodeEncodeError bug though, but
it gives us some test coverage anyway.

This change also adds docs on how to resolve bug 1746534
by configuring the environment for UTF-8 as noted in
the revert change Iaeec1e74262a35f3de3c81f7013835a6aa6f9029.

The documentation added here is shamelessly copied from
Click [1] which was found via the PEP 538 docs [2].

[1] https://click.palletsprojects.com/en/5.x/python3/#python-3-surrogate-handling
[2] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0538/

Change-Id: Ic7059260dfc031ea1b08d2b8a7cec684bbe7dfa5
Related-Bug: #1823287
Related-Bug: #1746534
(cherry picked from commit e8f7aaf9091330bbb046f2bd42dc9c92f1dcebaa)

commit_message:
Ansible module: fix partition_configdrive.sh file

Images with GPT partition tables could not be deployed correctly
The if condition could never be met due to an invalid syntax, leading to
partitioning failure

Change-Id: I11202b115f9b80e8c853dca36cc66ab0eb8f7dea
Story: #2005357
Task: #30317

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: Id8f0acf8fcf901f2bc3383f3bec168c8e9469394

subject: Standardize use and construction of endpoint URLs
messages:
[{'account_id': 28356, 'date': '2019-04-12 21:04:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-04-12 21:05:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 28356, 'date': '2019-04-12 21:55:06.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoned in favor of: https://review.openstack.org/652157'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-04-15 11:37:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-12 21:04:49.000000000', 'message': 'Standardize use and construction of endpoint URLs

The goal for this push request is to normalize the construction and use
 of internal, external, and admin URLs. While extending Kolla-ansible
 to enable a more flexible method to manage external URLs, we noticed
 that the same URL was constructed multiple times in different parts
 of the code. This can make it difficult for people that want to work
 with these URLs and create inconsistencies in a large code base with
 time. Therefore, we are proposing here the use of
 "single Kolla-ansible variable" per endpoint URL, which facilitates
 for people that are interested in overriding/extending these URLs.

As an example, we extended Kolla-ansible to facilitate the "override"
of public (external) URLs with the following standard
"<component/serviceName>.<companyBaseUrl>".
Therefore, the "NAT/redirect" in the SSL termination system (HAproxy,
HTTPD or some other) is done via the service name, and not by the port.
This allows operators to easily and automatically create more friendly
 URL names. To develop this feature, we first applied this patch that
 we are sending now to the community. We did that to reduce the surface
  of changes in Kolla-ansible.

Another example is the integration of Kolla-ansible and Consul, which
we also implemented internally, and also requires URLs changes.
Therefore, this PR is essential to reduce code duplicity, and to
facility users/developers to work/customize the services URLs.

Change-Id: I072f739328202131a874ca7d9b6947381f4963d9
'}]
commit_message:
Standardize use and construction of endpoint URLs

The goal for this push request is to normalize the construction and use
 of internal, external, and admin URLs. While extending Kolla-ansible
 to enable a more flexible method to manage external URLs, we noticed
 that the same URL was constructed multiple times in different parts
 of the code. This can make it difficult for people that want to work
 with these URLs and create inconsistencies in a large code base with
 time. Therefore, we are proposing here the use of
 "single Kolla-ansible variable" per endpoint URL, which facilitates
 for people that are interested in overriding/extending these URLs.

As an example, we extended Kolla-ansible to facilitate the "override"
of public (external) URLs with the following standard
"<component/serviceName>.<companyBaseUrl>".
Therefore, the "NAT/redirect" in the SSL termination system (HAproxy,
HTTPD or some other) is done via the service name, and not by the port.
This allows operators to easily and automatically create more friendly
 URL names. To develop this feature, we first applied this patch that
 we are sending now to the community. We did that to reduce the surface
  of changes in Kolla-ansible.

Another example is the integration of Kolla-ansible and Consul, which
we also implemented internally, and also requires URLs changes.
Therefore, this PR is essential to reduce code duplicity, and to
facility users/developers to work/customize the services URLs.

Change-Id: I072f739328202131a874ca7d9b6947381f4963d9

commit_message:
Remove RabbitMQ support from Bifrost

During the Train cycle, Bifrost switched to using JSON-RPC by default
for Ironic's internal communication [1], avoiding the need to install
RabbitMQ. This simplifies things, so we may as well remove our custom
configuration of RabbitMQ.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/645093

Change-Id: I3107349530aa753d68fd59baaf13eb7dd5485ae6

commit_message:
Fix bug preventing forbidden traits from working

Modifies _clean_empties function to take forbidden traits into account
in addition to required traits.

Added unit test test_resources_from_request_spec_flavor_forbidden_trait
to test that a single forbidden trait doesn't get lost in the
resources_from_request_spec function.

Also updated the functional test
test_flavor_forbidden_traits_based_scheduling to do the right thing.

Change-Id: I491b10c9c202baae4a37034848147f910a50eebf
Closes-Bug: #1821824
(cherry picked from commit c088856c8c08f0ab0746db7c120da494c9dd42d4)

commit_message:
Add become for prometheus-openstack-exporter tasks

commit_message:
Fix OVN yaql KeyError: type error (alternate)

In 30cfaccb493901279c0cbd4ea1dec68bed0f8286 the yaql data for the
OVNSouthboundServerPort was modified and is causing a KeyError in
Heat. This patch uses an integer for the yaql query.

Related-bug: 1824579

Change-Id: I22b202c6da994b59f445826ece6ffb78981891dd

commit_message:
Fix OVN yaql KeyError: type error

In 30cfaccb493901279c0cbd4ea1dec68bed0f8286 the yaql data for the
OVNSouthboundServerPort was modified and is causing a KeyError in
Heat. This patch uses an integer for the yaql query.

Change-Id: If903cd18ec1d6215024412a4050db11b3c74a93b
Related-bug: 1824579

Thank you for the patch. This needs a release note.

Also, I think Julia was looking into a solution that uses subprocesses to ensure that a console goes down when a conductor dies. That may fit a little better than this solution since it would require fewer changes to the base startup code for a conductor. I'm OK with whatever works, though."}, {'account_id': 13295, 'date': '2017-03-20 19:44:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Still waiting on release note, but it looks like people agree that this is a good strategy:

19:43:07         TheJulia | mariojv: I kind of like the patch as a one size fits all kind of thing.  Wax it all if it is the namespace and move on.  Processes exiting on their own doesn't
                          | always work, especially with udp sockets and ipmitool being involved :(

Feel free to ignore my previous comment except the part about the release note, now that I have this new context. :)"}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2017-03-21 03:53:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Looks good. One minor comment. Needs release notes.'}, {'account_id': 22724, 'date': '2017-03-21 12:19:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

> Still waiting on release note, but it looks like people agree that
 > this is a good strategy:
 > 
 > 19:43:07         TheJulia | mariojv: I kind of like the patch as a
 > one size fits all kind of thing.  Wax it all if it is the namespace
 > and move on.  Processes exiting on their own doesn't

 > involved :(
 > 
 > Feel free to ignore my previous comment except the part about the
 > release note, now that I have this new context. :)

Thanks, Mario, for the note. I was also scratching head over subprocesses a little. Agree with Julia, but sure she knows better.

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-03-16 14:36:12.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Ensure dying SOL console on conductor exit

We are using keepalive mode for IPMI Serial Over Lan console.
But when ironic-conductor dies it is not guaranteed that
SOL console also dies. It may still send ``keepalives`` to node.
This issue may break long-running sol sessions.
In some way it is needed to ensure that console process actually
dies on ironic-conductor exit.

Note: only normal program termination can be supported. Failures
of ironic-conductor are not considered to be catched

Change-Id: I02210ecbcff119279c5337484497b765296c9878
Related-Bug: 1618842
'}, {'created': '2017-03-16 14:44:57.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Ensure dying SOL console on conductor exit

In some way it is needed to ensure that console process actually

We are using keepalive mode for IPMI Serial Over Lan console.
But when ironic-conductor dies it is not guaranteed that
SOL console also dies. It may still send ``keepalives`` to node.
This issue may break long-running sol sessions.
In some way it is needed to ensure that console process and other
child processes actually die on ironic-conductor failure/exit.

This can be done starting ironic-conductor as service unit in systemd.
As ironic-conductor and its child processes have same cgroups, using
default systemd configuration child processes will be also killed
on any conductor exit. It works for each type of process killing.

Change-Id: I02210ecbcff119279c5337484497b765296c9878
Related-Bug: 1618842

commit_message:
Doc for console customization using systemd

We are using keepalive mode for IPMI Serial Over Lan console.
But when ironic-conductor dies it is not guaranteed that
SOL console also dies. It may still send ``keepalives`` to node.
This issue may break long-running sol sessions.
In some way it is needed to ensure that console process and other
child processes actually die on ironic-conductor exit.

This can be done starting ironic-conductor as service unit in systemd.
As ironic-conductor and its child processes have same cgroups, using
default systemd configuration, child processes will be also killed
on any conductor exit. It works for each type of process killing.

Change-Id: I02210ecbcff119279c5337484497b765296c9878
Related-Bug: 1618842

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-09-20 01:58:56.000000000', 'message': 'Make ironic console supporting the nokeepalive mode

Add an option `no_keep_alive` in the ironic.conf
making the ironic to start the console in a
nokeepalive mode.(ipmitool)

Change-Id: Ib10e666f9ea0276456d6a0e009724e933e6bec99
Closes-bug: #1618842
'}, {'created': '2016-09-20 02:03:43.000000000', 'message': 'Make ironic console supporting the nokeepalive mode

Add an option `no_keep_alive` in the ironic.conf
making the ironic to start the console in a
nokeepalive mode.(ipmitool)

Change-Id: Ib10e666f9ea0276456d6a0e009724e933e6bec99
Closes-bug: #1618842
'}, {'created': '2016-09-22 13:25:26.000000000', 'message': 'Make ironic console supporting the nokeepalive mode

Add an option `sol_mode` in the ironic.conf, it can be
"None", "usesolkeepalive" or "nokeepalive".
In order to choose a mode for the ipmitool to enter Serial Over LAN.

Change-Id: Ib10e666f9ea0276456d6a0e009724e933e6bec99
Closes-bug: #1618842
'}, {'created': '2016-09-23 10:19:24.000000000', 'message': 'Make ironic console supporting the nokeepalive mode

Change-Id: Ib10e666f9ea0276456d6a0e009724e933e6bec99
Closes-bug: #1618842
'}, {'created': '2017-02-16 15:35:20.000000000', 'message': 'Make ironic console supporting the nokeepalive mode

Add an option ``[console]sol_mode``, that can be
"usesolkeepalive" or "nokeepalive". If not set, no
mode will be chosen.
This will be used in ipmitool command when entering
Serial Over LAN.

Change-Id: Ib10e666f9ea0276456d6a0e009724e933e6bec99
Closes-bug: #1618842
'}, {'created': '2017-02-17 10:55:22.000000000', 'message': 'Make ironic console supporting the nokeepalive mode

By default ``ipmitool sol activate`` command sends keepalive
to keep the IPMI session from timing out. In some cases it
breaks long running sol sessions.

commit_message:
[To be Abandoned] Make ironic console supporting the nokeepalive mode

By default ``ipmitool sol activate`` command sends keepalive
to keep the IPMI session from timing out. In some cases it
breaks long running sol sessions, e.g. when conductor died
and new conductor has been started but still ipmi session
is still running.

This adds an option ``[console]sol_mode``, that can be
"keepalive" or "nokeepalive". If not set, no
mode will be chosen.
For now it is used in ipmitool command when entering
Serial Over LAN, but applicable to other drivers.

More appropriate work had been proposed, see the last comments

Change-Id: Ib10e666f9ea0276456d6a0e009724e933e6bec99
Closes-bug: #1618842

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

commit_message:
Baytech MRP27 PDU support

Initial commit hardcodes the unit_id to 1.
After investigation of the current environment, all of the targetted
PDUs are using a unit_id of 1.

Change-Id: I8d013cfcd10835b26fd3c90ac866e8e1795635c7
Closes-bug: #1634303

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-03 12:56:02.000000000', 'message': 'Adding tests to demonstrate bug #1821824

Fixed functional test test_flavor_traits_based_scheduling as it
would pass 50% of the times even if the required trait was not
taken into account by adding a new part that disables the compute
host that has the required trait and retries, expecting a no valid
host error.

Added functional test test_flavor_forbidden_traits_based_scheduling
to test that forbidden traits are taken into account.

The second test temporarily passes where it should not until the
next commit where the bug is actually fixed.

Change-Id: I1c7e2d5ff2e7b5158f8f2c4b2ebce5c20e99a984
Related-Bug: #1821824
(cherry picked from commit 13e661792d73c27bcc7616b6bf612b5784e994e3)
'}]
commit_message:
Adding tests to demonstrate bug #1821824

Fixed functional test test_flavor_traits_based_scheduling as it
would pass 50% of the times even if the required trait was not
taken into account by adding a new part that disables the compute
host that has the required trait and retries, expecting a no valid
host error.

Added functional test test_flavor_forbidden_traits_based_scheduling
to test that forbidden traits are taken into account.

The second test temporarily passes where it should not until the
next commit where the bug is actually fixed.

Change-Id: I1c7e2d5ff2e7b5158f8f2c4b2ebce5c20e99a984
Related-Bug: #1821824
(cherry picked from commit 13e661792d73c27bcc7616b6bf612b5784e994e3)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-09 13:21:50.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure all image cache volumes are removed before removing the volume type

Previously the only clean up action registered when creating a new
volume type was the direct removal of that type. However this request would
silently fail in the attached volume migration scenario tests if the
backends being used had their image volume cache enabled.

This was due to the image volume cache still containing volumes
associated to the given volume type when attempts were made to delete
the volume type. To avoid this these image volume cache volumes must be
manually removed by an admin user before deleting the volume type.

Closes-Bug: #1823880
Change-Id: Ib4d82586e91037729f9e846a6f0fac6d393ca475
'}, {'created': '2019-04-09 16:23:52.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure all image cache volumes are removed before removing the volume type

Previously the only clean up action registered when creating a new
volume type was the direct removal of that type. However this request would

Change-Id: Ib4d82586e91037729f9e846a6f0fac6d393ca475

commit_message:
Ensure all image cache volumes are removed before removing the volume type

Previously the only clean up action registered when creating a new
volume type was the direct removal of that type. However this request would
silently fail in the attached volume migration scenario tests if the
backends being used had their image volume cache enabled.

This was due to the image volume cache still containing volumes
associated to the given volume type when attempts were made to delete
the volume type. To avoid this these image volume cache volumes must be
manually removed by an admin user before deleting the volume type.

Closes-Bug: #1823880
Change-Id: Ib4d82586e91037729f9e846a6f0fac6d393ca475

commit_message:
Ensure the build host is the first repo server

The first repo server is the only one configured to synchronise
packages to the other repo servers. To ensure that the build
happens on the first server, we reverse the order in which they
are processed in the loop.

This does not solve the multi-architecture use-case. A solution
for that will have to follow.

Change-Id: Ie6bd16ac08164f7dba71339858b98137f61ad716
(cherry picked from commit 0f4c3457e44866dfb4c5fc5a392f139bec27281c)

commit_message:
Repair building guidelines

The recent yasfb is not compatible with ancient sphinx, just bump
both requirements, as well as replace deprecated oslosphinx with
openstackdocstheme (requirements shamelessly copied from ironic-specs).
While we're here, uncap pbr and bump it to 1.0.

Change-Id: Ia78499827a53f5ee0c7a8b0d9951a0e37dedc91b

commit_message:
Ensure venv_wheel_build_enable is evaluated as boolean

We use the bool filter to make sure that venv_wheel_build_enable
is evaluated as a boolean, rather than a string or something else.

Change-Id: Ice305d2239e55be7e1a6f30628b72cf442553fd5

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-08 03:15:56.000000000', 'message': 'Force to schedule even has force_hosts or force_nodes

Add force_schedule config into scheduler section. The
default value is False.

This setting causes the scheduler to evaluate the filters
which are defined in `[filter_scheduler]/enabled_filters`
even we specify the host to boot or live-migrate.

Change-Id: I20bb73a48a028a30468f2465842fe282677068ee
'}]
commit_message:
Force to schedule even has force_hosts or force_nodes

Add force_schedule config into scheduler section. The
default value is False.

This setting causes the scheduler to evaluate the filters
which are defined in `[filter_scheduler]/enabled_filters`
even we specify the host to boot or live-migrate.

Change-Id: I20bb73a48a028a30468f2465842fe282677068ee

> For the same reason as before, but now with slightly more code,

I am sorry, actually, I do not really understand your reason as before. Now if I do not change the code here.
In your specific case a malicious user could create a 'raw' image which actually contained a malicious qcow2 header specifying a backing file of the the compute host's root disk. This still would result in copying the compute host's root disk to the specified rbd volume and exposing it to the user directly through the command 'rbd import'."}, {'account_id': 28706, 'date': '2019-02-26 14:12:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Matt, thanks for your suggestion(2 ways) for this problem. But I do not take it as an incompatibility between 2 config variables. If I set the 'force_raw_images' to 'True', all qcow2 images will be converted as raw and raw images will cover more large storage spaces than 'qcow2'. The scene wasn't what I wanted.
And the secure hole as you mentioned above can be avoided by checking the backing_file of the image file like:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-20 05:02:03.000000000', 'message': "Convert to raw format into rbd volume

If the image format is qcow2, then the temp image file in _base
folder will be qcow2 format. So using command 'rbd import' to import
image file into rbd volume is just to use qcow2 format image.

When using a qcow2 as root disk, the instance is spawned but fails to
boot because data is accessed as raw.

So try to use 'qemu-img convert' to convert into raw format into
rbd volume.

Change-Id: I18fba88a96535209b7a327b7a3eb8a93ca36e49a
Closes-Bug: 1816686
"}, {'created': '2019-02-20 07:28:29.000000000', 'message': "Convert to raw format into rbd volume

boot because data is accessed as raw.

So try to use 'qemu-img convert' to convert into raw format into
rbd volume.

Change-Id: I18fba88a96535209b7a327b7a3eb8a93ca36e49a
Closes-Bug: 1816686

image file into rbd volume is just to use qcow2 format image.

When using a qcow2 as root disk, the instance is spawned but fails to
boot because data is accessed as raw.

So that, get and check the format of image file. Then choose the right

image file into rbd volume is just to use qcow2 format image.

When using a qcow2 as root disk, the instance is spawned but fails to
boot because data is accessed as raw.

So that, get and check the format of image file. Then choose the right
way to import rbd volume from image file.

Change-Id: I18fba88a96535209b7a327b7a3eb8a93ca36e49a
Closes-Bug: 1816686

commit_message:
Convert to raw format into rbd volume

If the image format is qcow2, then the temp image file in _base
folder will be qcow2 format. So using command 'rbd import' to import
image file into rbd volume is just to use qcow2 format image.

When using a qcow2 as root disk, the instance is spawned but fails to
boot because data is accessed as raw.

So that, get and check the format of image file. Then choose the right
way to import rbd volume from image file.

Change-Id: I18fba88a96535209b7a327b7a3eb8a93ca36e49a
Closes-Bug: 1816686

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html

commit_message:
Add details on target_raid_config for Software RAID support

This patch adds some details on how the target_raid_config for
Software RAID support is supposed to look like: the 'controller'
property is used to signal that a configuration is intended for
a Software RAID setup and is also used to trigger the installation
of a bootloader for whole disk images (which is not needed otherwise).

Change-Id: I3b8191f7653d2dccbcb0dd6b45b5b94cb56ba4cf
Story: #2004581
Task: #28366

(9 comments)

Hi Julia, interesting idea. I need to think about this a bit...

Realistically, we should be able to cache the information; we can detect when the ramdisk version changes. But maybe that is only a performance issue and whoever wants this API doesn't care.

I also need to think about this 'holding' state -- it seems like the logic gets complicated if the node can get to holding from diff previous states, and that where the node goes *after* holding depends on the state it had been in, before it got to holding... we might just need to tweak things a bit, or add two diff holding states. not sure yet. (and not sure why we'd want to go to 'holding' from two diff states, won't one suffice?)"}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-10-05 17:16:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> (9 comments)
 > 
 > Hi Julia, interesting idea. I need to think about this a bit...
 > 
 > Realistically, we should be able to cache the information; we can
 > detect when the ramdisk version changes. But maybe that is only a
 > performance issue and whoever wants this API doesn't care.
 > 
 > I also need to think about this 'holding' state -- it seems like
 > the logic gets complicated if the node can get to holding from diff
 > previous states, and that where the node goes *after* holding
 > depends on the state it had been in, before it got to holding... we
 > might just need to tweak things a bit, or add two diff holding
 > states. not sure yet. (and not sure why we'd want to go to
 > 'holding' from two diff states, won't one suffice?)

In reverse thought order, since that seems to be the only way I think about things. Sorry :(

I was kind of thinking a similar thing that we've done with cleaning in that there is some conditional logic to check the next state, hence why I put the verbs in the chart to help convey the path. Since clean can be called in from multiple places, at least invoked.

I think we can cache, but..... I'm also thinking maybe we shouldn't because users don't know the state of the data and if we contractually say "this is only what we are able to collect at this moment" then that solves part of the conundrum and even data model impact of the lower layers. I feel like we should only provide a information as needed. Maybe the answer here as well, to help convey if IPA is up, is have an "ipa-noop" or "ipa-sleep" step (which could be useful for things like burn-ins) which would appear in the list of cleaning steps. That would be a huge indication that IPA is up, running, and can be interacted with.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-10-05 17:37:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2018-10-17 08:05:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(3 comments)

This is looking great! I have some wording recommendation nits and a suggestion on the documentation section.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-10-19 15:32:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-10-19 16:06:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

messages: [{'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-04-10 13:42:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/rocky.'}, {'account_id': 29632, 'date': '2019-04-11 11:29:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-04-11 11:36:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-04-15 09:25:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-10 13:42:14.000000000', 'message': 'Show share network details to non-admin

Horizon attempts to show associated share servers when displaying
share network details in the project share-networks dashboard.  But
unless the horizon user is an admin this generates a 403 exception
which in turn causes Horizon to pop-up an error message about being
unable to retrieve share network details.

So instead catch exceptions collecting share server information in
this context and continue on gracefully, presenting the share server
details that are available.

Change-Id: I822ba95dc8e41df2775f908c287565f5da6a7e9d
Closes-Bug: #1702396
(cherry picked from commit 070fd98e7d67c5cd73a23b293167723dfbfeb9e5)
(cherry picked from commit 68dab30b12860c62fb21dcdd04fab98788890532)
'}]
commit_message:
Show share network details to non-admin

Horizon attempts to show associated share servers when displaying
share network details in the project share-networks dashboard.  But
unless the horizon user is an admin this generates a 403 exception
which in turn causes Horizon to pop-up an error message about being
unable to retrieve share network details.

So instead catch exceptions collecting share server information in
this context and continue on gracefully, presenting the share server
details that are available.

Change-Id: I822ba95dc8e41df2775f908c287565f5da6a7e9d
Closes-Bug: #1702396
(cherry picked from commit 070fd98e7d67c5cd73a23b293167723dfbfeb9e5)
(cherry picked from commit 68dab30b12860c62fb21dcdd04fab98788890532)

commit_message:
Add share servers to share network detail

We're missing share servers in the network
detailed view. Also, it's not helpful to
show either Share Servers or Security Services
when none exist (or are not retrievable).

Change-Id: Iacb8145f7865d73c479130cbe94078b4cc5c831a
Partial-Bug: #1702396
(cherry picked from commit c8723091ed7f6ce19511f3ab666b2d7757557b2c)

[{'created': '2019-04-08 11:47:06.000000000', 'message': 'Fix conflict exceptions handling in LB creation

I0a2f89007994fbd7696b0f487affc1b7b643be74 is breaking our workaround for
IP conflict when Kuryr-Controller dies during some LB processing. In
that case, when LB is already created, Kuryr will try to create it again
and fail with either 409 or 500. We should react to those exceptions and
aforementioned patch breaks that by changing the type of exceptions
being raised.

This patch fixes that by adding correct requests.HTTPError exception
type to that try-except clause.

Change-Id: Ic41fe6d5556b2b4721871f9812ddc039a52cf366
Closes-Bug: 1823701
'}, {'created': '2019-04-09 10:21:28.000000000', 'message': 'Fix conflict exceptions handling in LB creation

I0a2f89007994fbd7696b0f487affc1b7b643be74 is breaking our workaround for
IP conflict when Kuryr-Controller dies during some LB processing. In
that case, when LB is already created, Kuryr will try to create it again
and fail with either 409 or 500. We should react to those exceptions and
aforementioned patch breaks that by changing the type of exceptions
being raised.

This patch fixes that by adding correct requests.HTTPError exception
type to that try-except clause.

Change-Id: Ic41fe6d5556b2b4721871f9812ddc039a52cf366
Closes-Bug: 1823701
'}]
commit_message:
Fix conflict exceptions handling in LB creation

I0a2f89007994fbd7696b0f487affc1b7b643be74 is breaking our workaround for
IP conflict when Kuryr-Controller dies during some LB processing. In
that case, when LB is already created, Kuryr will try to create it again
and fail with either 409 or 500. We should react to those exceptions and
aforementioned patch breaks that by changing the type of exceptions
being raised.

This patch fixes that by adding correct requests.HTTPError exception
type to that try-except clause.

Change-Id: Ic41fe6d5556b2b4721871f9812ddc039a52cf366
Closes-Bug: 1823701

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Id0bd2c2e1463038961e2bc661e331cf1ed84ac80

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-13 23:36:17.000000000', 'message': "doc: drop release notes + fix sphinxmark

The ops repo isn't really software.   It's a collection of playbooks
that we share between operators, therefore, release notes are a bit
confusing because there are so many playbooks inside of it.

They're also broken because of how we have a few links all over the
place.  There has been no release notes published either.

sphinxmark is no longer compatible with the latest release of Sphinx
which is causing all of our documentation jobs to fail.  This patch
removes it as our current usage of openstacktheme for documentation
already provides watermarks for current branch and notices for which
branch the documentation covers.

Change-Id: I521647c999e7dc17ba27f02bc5bccd422d97ab9a
Closes-Bug: #1824664
"}]
commit_message:
doc: drop release notes + fix sphinxmark

The ops repo isn't really software.   It's a collection of playbooks
that we share between operators, therefore, release notes are a bit
confusing because there are so many playbooks inside of it.

They're also broken because of how we have a few links all over the
place.  There has been no release notes published either.

sphinxmark is no longer compatible with the latest release of Sphinx
which is causing all of our documentation jobs to fail.  This patch
removes it as our current usage of openstacktheme for documentation
already provides watermarks for current branch and notices for which
branch the documentation covers.

Change-Id: I521647c999e7dc17ba27f02bc5bccd422d97ab9a
Closes-Bug: #1824664

commit_message:
Check for apache pid on service restart

For openstack services fronted by apache WSGI, we need to check
for correct apache process restart in containerized environments
where there are more than one apache container

Closes-Bug: #1795918

Change-Id: Ic38e0224058c12bf504b87065710d986b61d64ae

[{'account_id': 29575, 'date': '2018-11-26 17:03:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-11-26 17:03:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 14885, 'date': '2018-11-26 17:04:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Stop adding extra options when wheel build is disabled

If we're not building wheels inside a repo_server, then there's
no need to point towards the links and the trusted host because
there's nothing to find there anyways.

Change-Id: Ia977edbb75451f285abbdb64ac1249115ed52a5c
(cherry picked from commit 9563818f699ca6787e565c06f3f8fd99511efdba)

commit_message:
Require an IP when advertising remote unit

Require that a pacemaker remote unit specifies an IP address for
cluster traffic when joining with an existing cluster. This makes
sure the correct netowrk is used in a network space aware
deployment.

Change-Id: I92b3f2644c7bee4e55463ffaae2769c33458dd16
Closes-Bug: #1824514

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I3fad4de4568138d36258934d933e0205515fb0ba

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ib8da36984dfe9d437f591c7f01e007496836cab2
Closes-Bug:  #1801657

commit_message:
Remove deprecated value used to set nova_metadata_ip

Remove place where we set value that is not using
anymore in neutron puppet (this value was used to set
nova_metadata_ip in neutron metadata agent, currently
this param is replaced by nova_metadata_host)

Change-Id: I108d3e8577ca0522c70e6b5f5728ed32eb354665
Closes-Bug: 1787550

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I52a390177356da2e79aac8789a9ef96d57043149

commit_message:
Add support for policyTypes at Network Policies

This patch adds support to consider policyTypes when applying network
policies. It ensures ingress/egress traffic is allowed when the
network policy is not affecting them if not targetted by the policyTypes

Closes-Bug: 1822333
Change-Id: I3281e1ca2c4dcaf38ac9bd220eb4e91b5484904d
(cherry picked from commit b653be469b7c3d47b6cf82d075dc8474ab00c10e)

commit_message:
Update model to support ApplyTime annotations

The @Redfish.OperationApplyTimeSupport annotation is currently
incorrectly being read from within @Redfish.Settings annotations.
Update to instead read it from Actions and VolumeCollection.

Add new field class for the @Redfish.SettingsApplyTime annotation
and read it from the Bios Settings resource.

Change-Id: I083d717ce8801eda0f3b0a24dd1eef0ca2c14709
Story: 2005218
Task: 29997

[{'created': '2019-03-21 08:31:06.000000000', 'message': "Stop using /etc/pki/CA in TLS setup

This directory is no longer available in CentOS 8, so we stop using it
for the services that use it (namely nova's qemu/libvirt/vnc
configurations and HAProxy). Opting for /etc/pki/tls/certs instead where

Change-Id: I015067a805bbd15343899cb44823b0a178637232

commit_message:
Stop using /etc/pki/CA in TLS setup

This directory is no longer available in CentOS 8, so we stop using it
for the services that use it (namely nova's qemu/libvirt/vnc
configurations and HAProxy). Opting for /etc/pki/tls/certs instead where
applicable.

Change-Id: I015067a805bbd15343899cb44823b0a178637232
Closes-Bug: #1821139
Depends-On: I208bb53c2a270d770d114116fde3f062c0d66985

commit_message:
Stop using /etc/pki/CA for CRL

This directory is not available in CentOS 8, so lets use
/etc/pki/tls/misc instead.

Change-Id: Ide6e196a524eb140e745f02b6faf917839a5540b
Related-Bug: #1821139

commit_message:
Pin tempest plugin

To ensure testing stays working for as long as possible,
and matches with the version of tempest used, we use the
plugin tag/SHA which was released around the same time
as the series.

Change-Id: I62ef388bf0fe69affa01cf13027d2deebff3c602

commit_message:
Add heat dashboard if available to horizon

Currently there is no enabling of the heat dashboard if its
installed on the horizon image.

This patch add an extra conf var that allows several dashboards
to be added and will try to find and enable them on start

If the panel dirs dont exists, it will do nothing

This patch add the extra heat_dashboard and includes the existing
neutron_taas_dashboard into the new config

Change-Id: Ibcc4da166d907f3cb842bfc45d842a650361a2d8

commit_message:
Replace hardcoded yum command by package manager variable

Fix hardcoded yum command by package manager variable, PKG_MANAGER
in scripts/install-deps.sh. That was problem on Fedora where default
package manager is dnf and not yum.

Change-Id: I2dbec079adbfcab71e46e086fcd201a5175f22d5
Story: 2005451
Task: 30503

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I08d1764ad06ae1a30f5c3e30437823459bac7ec8

subject: Add support to deploy manila-api with Apache/wsgi
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 14826, 'name': 'Mark Goddard', 'email': 'mark@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'mgoddard'}, {'_account_id': 16643, 'name': 'Goutham Pacha Ravi', 'email': 'gouthampravi@gmail.com', 'username': 'gouthamr'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24072, 'name': 'Marcin Juszkiewicz', 'email': 'marcin.juszkiewicz+kolla@linaro.org', 'username': 'hrw'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-04-09 19:59:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-04-09 21:11:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/queens as commit c7a3e8b7054cf3221d2b6d709f4beb08adee483c'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-04-10 08:15:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Does this fix a bug?'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-04-10 20:20:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Does this fix a bug?

Hi Mark, 

Yes. We discovered a downstream issue using using SSL with Manila API which uses eventlet. While triaging the issue, we realized it is simpler and more maintainable to follow the project's directions to deploy manila-API with Apache rather than use the in-built eventlet wsgi server. These changes should not negatively affect anyone who intends to continue running manila with the eventlet server; but they will support anyone who intends to switch to httpd. There's also the issue of python3 readiness for the inbuilt eventlet module [1], which can be bypassed by either terminating TLS connections elsewhere, or by using apache/nginx to front-end the Manila API. 

My intention is to take this fix to stable/queens, since it is a long-term supportable release for most distributions (Ubuntu 16.04 LTS, Ubuntu 18.04 LTS, RHEL 7.x, etc). 

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.service/+bug/1482633"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-04-12 09:10:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2019-04-15 07:37:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-09 19:59:29.000000000', 'message': 'Add support to deploy manila-api with Apache/wsgi

- Add required packages to run the manila-api service
  with Apache/mod_wsgi, the mod_ssl package has been
  added for RHEL/centos/oraclelinux only.
- Add necessary cleanup to the start script of the container.
- Add directories and configuration files that can be
  optionally used via Docker entrypoints.

Change-Id: Id88760655b3419e7b6bec012ebfda16fb92e5ea3
Implements: bp apache-packages-for-manila-api
(cherry picked from commit 170be6d17a2e4b85e376a88131ca488c619bebaf)
'}]
commit_message:
Add support to deploy manila-api with Apache/wsgi

- Add required packages to run the manila-api service
  with Apache/mod_wsgi, the mod_ssl package has been
  added for RHEL/centos/oraclelinux only.
- Add necessary cleanup to the start script of the container.
- Add directories and configuration files that can be
  optionally used via Docker entrypoints.

Change-Id: Id88760655b3419e7b6bec012ebfda16fb92e5ea3
Implements: bp apache-packages-for-manila-api
(cherry picked from commit 170be6d17a2e4b85e376a88131ca488c619bebaf)

subject: Add delay option to std.echo to emulate external lags.
messages:
[{'account_id': 29124, 'date': '2019-04-12 14:34:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2019-04-15 02:32:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

A small comment on the code. And I also think that such a small thing doesn't require a blueprint. A bug is enough. If you don't need to back port it then even a bug is not needed, you can just make a change. A blueprint should be typically filed for a new feature or a serious change (e.g. refactoring etc.)."}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2019-04-15 08:19:51.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

In favor of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/652579/'}]

[{'created': '2019-04-15 02:36:23.000000000', 'message': "Fix OVN yaql KeyError: type error

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639119/ changed
the 'metadata_settings' RoleData for ovn-metadata
to {} which caused a TypeError, this patch reverts

Closes-Bug: #1824579

commit_message:
Fix OVN yaql KeyError: type error

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639119/ changed
the 'metadata_settings' RoleData for ovn-metadata
to {} which caused a TypeError, this patch reverts
the metadata_settings to original to fix the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1824579
Change-Id: I09ed9c99065c946760c5319086ff0dbccd29a85c

commit_message:
Check for apache pid on service restart

For openstack services fronted by apache WSGI, we need to check
for correct apache process restart in containerized environments
where there are more than one apache container

Closes-Bug: #1795918

Change-Id: I15b2779451e0be021e2f04be7b9b86d1dae16e52

commit_message:
DNM: Test jobs running on bionic instead of xenial

We want to migrate to the latest Ubuntu LTS release 18.04 aka Bionic.
This is just a patch to find possible issues for Tacker gate jobs before
the real migration starts. Tacker has two jobs which is derived from
'devstack' base job which is migrated to Bionic in Depends-On patch.

[0] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/devstack-bionic
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/610977

Change-Id: I60f14968c5b8debf74ec4d99704bb5c6e37e0b07

[{'created': '2019-03-28 18:24:38.000000000', 'message': "NP: Delete default egress rules

When an SG is created, Neutron populates it with egress rules allowing
it to call anything. This isn't compliant with how network policies are
supposed to work in K8s. In order to correctly block all traffic we need
to remove those rules when creating the SG and this patch implements it.

Change-Id: I20860a52af843f770b6af5db65cfd9fb3e42ccfd
Closes-Bug: 1822174
"}]
commit_message:
NP: Delete default egress rules

When an SG is created, Neutron populates it with egress rules allowing
it to call anything. This isn't compliant with how network policies are
supposed to work in K8s. In order to correctly block all traffic we need
to remove those rules when creating the SG and this patch implements it.

Change-Id: I20860a52af843f770b6af5db65cfd9fb3e42ccfd
Closes-Bug: 1822174

commit_message:
NP: Create allow-all SG and add it to pod SG's

In order to be compliant with how network policies are supposed to work
in K8s, we need to allow all ingress and egress traffic for pods without
any NP applied. This patch ensures such behavior in DevStack by making
it create an allow-all SG and adding it to pod_security_groups when
network policy support is enabled.

Change-Id: I76c9082c52c17c833a22751f4352d0c469f573bd
Closes-Bug: 1822170

commit_message:
Pin coredns container image to 1.4.0 tag

coredns 1.5.0 got released recently and removed the proxy plugin which
we use, resulting in coredns being broken. Let's just pin the container
image tag to 1.4.0, as we don't want to fix our config each time coredns
is updated. We can move it forward consciously once there's some feature
we want.

Change-Id: I9099b13b4530049d0218e7165e8e85d14a459f5e
Closes-Bug: 1823855

oslo_cache.memcache_pool uses the same dogpile.cache but adds support of
pools, which may mark one memcached backend as dead, when instance
is down. os_nova uses oslo_cache.memcache_pool for some time,

commit_message:
Use oslo_cache.memcache_pool as cache backend

oslo_cache.memcache_pool uses the same dogpile.cache but adds support of
pools, which may mark one memcached backend as dead, when instance
is down. os_nova uses oslo_cache.memcache_pool for some time,
so this patch adds some unification for our roles as well.

Change-Id: Ice9a806aa4c6ab60c665f35b7197555f405ac0eb

commit_message:
Fix ubuntu binary deploys

1. Install python3-pymysql in placement-base image.
2. Remove default placement WSGI config.
3. Use python3 for manage.py in horizon

Change-Id: Ibb620af2241e39fe99bc48757f90296c0d77d438
Partial-Bug: #1823989
(cherry picked from commit 6c0065185943355851308ae4df23b73918fab7be)

commit_message:
Add config option use_dumb_init to add it to container images

Usage of dumb-init can also be disabled from cli with
`--nouse-dumb-init` when building images.

Also moves ENTRYPOINT outside of dumb_init_installation
block.

Change-Id: Id32d54fc9913b83cf121ede5a5e265e0772062ae
Related-Bug: #1821970
(cherry picked from commit fb4cb9efda5a522ba0d837047385b61275d09150)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-14 10:25:16.000000000', 'message': "Fix periodic CI jobs

Periodic jobs don't have zuul.change defined, since there is no change
being tested. This causes an early failure when referencing zuul.change
to set the image tag for built images. In periodic jobs we'll never need
to build images because there is no dependent kolla change under test.

Change-Id: I6d9d81cf17b7d0d7aaf87cd96418c904c46681f2
"}]
commit_message:
Fix periodic CI jobs

Periodic jobs don't have zuul.change defined, since there is no change
being tested. This causes an early failure when referencing zuul.change
to set the image tag for built images. In periodic jobs we'll never need
to build images because there is no dependent kolla change under test.

Change-Id: I6d9d81cf17b7d0d7aaf87cd96418c904c46681f2

subject: [ironic] Add final releases and pike-em tags
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages: [{'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-04-15 05:29:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-04-15 05:55:51.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nWe cant'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-15 05:29:09.000000000', 'message': "[ironic] Add final releases and pike-em tags

This is a procedural review to:
a. Tag a final release for each deliverables ; and
b. Tag that release as the last for pike (the pike-em tag)

It's possible that the release isn't needed (for example if there are no code
changes sine the previous release, sadly that's non-trivial to detect en masse.

If you are the PTL or release liaison for this team please +1 this review
if it is ready or -1 and take over the review to correct mistakes.

Change-Id: Iaae896c64125bd225a39f66a7d48c1acd847c44d
"}]
commit_message:
[ironic] Add final releases and pike-em tags

This is a procedural review to:
a. Tag a final release for each deliverables ; and
b. Tag that release as the last for pike (the pike-em tag)

It's possible that the release isn't needed (for example if there are no code
changes sine the previous release, sadly that's non-trivial to detect en masse.

If you are the PTL or release liaison for this team please +1 this review
if it is ready or -1 and take over the review to correct mistakes.

Change-Id: Iaae896c64125bd225a39f66a7d48c1acd847c44d

commit_message:
[manila] Add final releases and pike-em tags

This is a procedural review to:
a. Tag a final release for each deliverables ; and
b. Tag that release as the last for pike (the pike-em tag)

It's possible that the release isn't needed (for example if there are no code
changes sine the previous release, sadly that's non-trivial to detect en masse.

If you are the PTL or release liaison for this team please +1 this review
if it is ready or -1 and take over the review to correct mistakes.

Change-Id: I2cb1a341041345bd563c2346569cdb98b12650ac

b. Tag that release as the last for pike (the pike-em tag)

It's possible that the release isn't needed (for example if there are no code
changes sine the previous release, sadly that's non-trivial to detect en masse.

If you are the PTL or release liaison for this team please +1 this review
if it is ready or -1 and take over the review to correct mistakes.

Change-Id: I5ae5acfc65fff9254278f19b8ccee727e024c9ca

[{'created': '2019-03-18 14:55:53.000000000', 'message': 'Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ica9b2b448ae8df7232c9eb0de80817f348a5d71f

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: If9409536cb0df626d0865d228b633cd67960c600

commit_message:
Update master for stable/stein

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/stein.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/stein.

Change-Id: I33c314ef84413b42ae5572a927a874d508eb27e4
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Add VNF to monitor after restarting tacker service

If you restart tacker service, it doesn't monitor previously
created VNFs.

This patch will read all VNFs from db and add to monitor
during initialization of VFNM plugin.

Change-Id: I1d49f9442dbc34794e01fbefb4ef82af21171956
Closes-Bug: #1616712
(cherry picked from commit 5ae9dd03c7ce43ed8a54b1d4f428231988b471fd)

commit_message:
Marking CIDR as mandatory field on Add rule form in security_group panel

When selecting the remote as CIDR,
the CIDR value field is mandatory but isn't marked as mandatory.
This patch marks it as mandatory.

Change-Id: I2125813d6fb58e311b6bef821a88c78ab0fc6cfc
Closes-Bug: #1816330

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I1fd0241e2c03567df7a9087f995244944fff296f

subject: Fix calico node
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-28 10:41:00.000000000', 'message': "Fix calico node

With k8s v1.12.5, calico node failed to start because calico node
is requiring net.ipv4.conf.all.rp_filter=1 which by default it's 2
on Fedora Atomic 27.

The valid value of net.ipv4.conf.all.rp_filter is one of the following:
0 — No source validation.
1 — Strict mode as defined in RFC 3704.
2 — Loose mode as defined in RFC 3704.

Task: 30226
Story: 2005318

Change-Id: I24b2525994c5f42f66b45ffdca5e5198e68429d5
"}]
commit_message:
Fix calico node

With k8s v1.12.5, calico node failed to start because calico node
is requiring net.ipv4.conf.all.rp_filter=1 which by default it's 2
on Fedora Atomic 27.

The valid value of net.ipv4.conf.all.rp_filter is one of the following:
0 — No source validation.
1 — Strict mode as defined in RFC 3704.
2 — Loose mode as defined in RFC 3704.

Task: 30226
Story: 2005318

Change-Id: I24b2525994c5f42f66b45ffdca5e5198e68429d5

commit_message:
Branch roles that were added during stein cycle

The file deliverables/stein/openstack-ansible-roles.yaml was
produced at the beginning of the stein cycle, but OpenStack-Ansible
added roles into governance during the stein cycle.

Because those roles were not part of this deliverable file at
branching time, the new roles were not branched.

This should fix it.

Change-Id: I55cadf45e155bd66ba083f00fd3bb5c74c35457c

JSON format responses. The osc_lib does not request JSON by default

commit_message:
Make sure we always requests JSON responses

This patch updates the client to make sure we are always requesting
JSON format responses. The osc_lib does not request JSON by default
for API calls.
If we don't request JSON responses, the Octavia API can return HTML
formated responses.

Change-Id: I7f64d0c1c74b67ab1097d00282e55b9ba1a4f5a7
Story: 2004283
Task: 27833
(cherry picked from commit 14875d44d45d24527f2c92ca770759b798e189ea)

commit_message:
Make sure we always requests JSON responses

This patch updates the client to make sure we are always requesting
JSON format responses. The osc_lib does not request JSON by default
for API calls.
If we don't request JSON responses, the Octavia API can return HTML
formated responses.

Change-Id: I7f64d0c1c74b67ab1097d00282e55b9ba1a4f5a7
Story: 2004283
Task: 27833
(cherry picked from commit 14875d44d45d24527f2c92ca770759b798e189ea)

Rename flat-db network for trove

We are renaming the flat network for trove
in order to match the required flat name
that is dbaas-mgmt.

commit_message:
Add trove_service_net_setup to aio deploy

Since we are using integrated tests, the services
overrides for role tests are not applied, which causes
trove to fail.

Change-Id: I6ba46a631e7a8f191159908bd6fd229dae4b1742

subject: Add required-project to openstack-tox-docs
messages:
[{'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-04-13 01:08:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-04-13 01:10:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Yes please. FYI, the hack that led to this: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/652176/'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-04-13 07:09:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

we have neutron and horizon specific tox jobs, you can create another one - or you create it in-tree and use it everywhere.

I don't see the need to change this for all jobs."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-04-13 09:53:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

note this also means that you *always* test with the git version and never with the latest release. Is that really what you want?'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-04-13 12:59:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> note this also means that you *always* test with the git version and never with the latest release. Is that really what you want?

Is that really how this always works? Normally when I make a change to a lib and depend on it, and then the dep merges, it is no longer picked up until it's released and requirements bumped. At least that's what I thought...

Anyway, it would be pretty harmless here regardless considering how s-f-c is used, so <shrug>. It would seem a shame to make a separate openstack-tox-docs-with-sphinx-feature-classification job and not be able to use the docs pti template after working so hard to cut everyone over to it.

Is there not another way to make this work?"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-04-13 14:54:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

You can inherit from the docs template'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-04-13 16:56:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I think you would use the normal openstack-tox-docs job, but if you wanted to be able to prove out something in your docs build with an unreleased feature of sphinx-feature-classification then you could either create a persistent variant which installs it from latest source instead of from releases (and yes, that is essential to how depends-on works), or add it temporarily in the demo change. Keeping the openstack-tox-docs job as it is now helps ensure you don't accidentally merge a change to your docs which can't be built without an unreleased feature of sphinx-feature-classification."}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-04-14 22:12:18.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-13 01:08:21.000000000', 'message': 'Add required-project to openstack-tox-docs

This patch adds openstack/sphinx-feature-classification to the
required-projects list on the openstack-tox-docs job.
Cinder and soon Octavia are using this oslo library and would like
to be able to use depends-on against sphinx-feature-classification
patches.

Change-Id: I0f48ccc8c72227cbf23a3d9c9c66685357362f08
'}]
commit_message:
Add required-project to openstack-tox-docs

This patch adds openstack/sphinx-feature-classification to the
required-projects list on the openstack-tox-docs job.
Cinder and soon Octavia are using this oslo library and would like
to be able to use depends-on against sphinx-feature-classification
patches.

Change-Id: I0f48ccc8c72227cbf23a3d9c9c66685357362f08

commit_message:
flatten the neutron-plugin-mlnx-sdn service

This change combines the previous puppet and docker files into a single
file that performs the docker service installation and configuration
for the neutron-plugin-ml2-mlnx-sdn-assist service.

Related-Blueprint: services-yaml-flattening

Change-Id: I0b1e0b52f26a57847263f311ea0c018bc15df46f

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I8333ca269b4d196376ba17fdd5b1ecf8a012ceaa

commit_message:
Set Tempest's service_availability setting for Aodh

Tempest's service_available config option includes all the service
availability which is further used by tests to take decision of skip
or run the test.

For example, [service_available].aodh is true then, aodh test will run
or if [service_available].aodh is false then, all aodh related tests either
in telemetry tempest plugin or any other plugins will be skipped.

This commit add the setting of aodh service[1] on aodh devstack plugin.

Closes-Bug: #1743688
[1] https://github.com/openstack/telemetry-tempest-plugin/blob/master/telemetry_tempest_plugin/config.py#L27

Change-Id: Idac9f38aac6964ce4d40b6afccbd9dfbf6e16a41

commit_message:
Only pull in jobs from opendev/base-jobs to openstack

We want the opendev tentant to be where we run jobs on the opendev
repos. Only load jobs and secrets in the openstack tenant.

Change-Id: Ibf137162a52e92fffc0d5283e543ffc8f7013ad8

commit_message:
Add error-handling for permission of /etc/octavia

create_certificates.sh requires permission of /etc/octavia basically
and creates certificates under that. If not granting enough permission
the script creates these files under current directory and that makes
mess. So this patch adds minimum error-handling for avoiding that.

Change-Id: I5166329a7c45c8f17890f11af99bedb206144de5

debian: add support

This patch adds the Debian jobs for this role to make sure
it's always passing as well as updates the meta and creates
debian.yml var file to reflect it's support of Debian accordingly.

commit_message:
debian: add support

This patch updates the meta to reflect it's support
of Debian accordingly as well as rename ubuntu vars
file to debian.

We also add in vars/debian the correspondent docker-ce
uri and gpg_uri.

Change-Id: Icf91eee6e369d9a6a95dd0c8772c2760eaff5bd2

metal jobs to serve roles as panko, ceilometer, gnocchi.

commit_message:
Stop adding extra options when wheel build is disabled

If we're not building wheels inside a repo_server, then there's
no need to point towards the links and the trusted host because
there's nothing to find there anyways.

Change-Id: Ia977edbb75451f285abbdb64ac1249115ed52a5c

rsyslog runs as root on debian vs. syslog user on ubuntu, so I think this is a case of needing an alternative setting for haproxy_log_directory_owner on debian"}, {'account_id': 28008, 'date': '2019-04-08 18:12:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

It also clean-up an old variable which is carried for upgrades

or configuring the system via the role.

commit_message:
debian: add ci and update meta

This patch adds the Debian jobs for this role to make sure
it's always passing as well as updates the meta to reflect
it's support of Debian accordingly.

It also clean-up an old variable which is carried for upgrades
that is no longer relevant now.

A new variable has been added to ensure pre-packages, which
have been generally assumed to be installed as a base OS
package, have been installed before installing the application
or configuring the system via the role.

Depends-On: I135ea73604890eae5e9e2a7cdcab81b2b39ad426
Change-Id: I19094b540aff81b7aa029880e404a2990f82e538
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>

commit_message:
debian: add ci and update meta

This patch adds the Debian jobs for this role to make sure
it's always passing as well as updates the meta to reflect
it's support of Debian accordingly.

Depends-On: I135ea73604890eae5e9e2a7cdcab81b2b39ad426

commit_message:
Remove osd_objectstore default

We don't need to enforce filestore objectstore anymore and instead
prefer new deployments to default to bluestore.

Change-Id: Ie26d158879b5458e4c54d62db946238b1ed33942

commit_message:
Make Ceph RGW accept ResellerAdmin role for administration

Grants ResellerAdmin role admin privileges to Ceph RGW, like Swift.

Change-Id: I62f144341881c9f0cf201cd4af6ee07e01a763b2
Co-Authored-By: Pritha Srivastava <prsrivas@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Enable objects versioning for Ceph RadosGW

We enabled objects versioning for Swift in the Newton release [1],
this change aligns the RGW configuration to have the same behavior.

1. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/384616/

Change-Id: I6dbdd0eac52cceaad9ee74d707591540cf3f5ef1
Co-Authored-By: Pritha Srivastava <prsrivas@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: 1632215

Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Ie6f6196191bf0d3b1a41dc01b5ac751d3bba839e

commit_message:
gnocchi_resources override fixed

gnocchi_resources.yaml has been defined in main.yml, had all required
variables, but user overrides were not actually deployed on containers
Also, it had an absolete path in GIT repo.

Depends-On: I0044a3e80be05f27a865f57ecf3c09605b3aa93e
Change-Id: Id32789b59f913cfbb78c1cb4a73b18df85c36655

commit_message:
Fix calico service unit user/group

The wrong vars were being passed to systemd_service, so the agents
were being run as neutron/neutron instead of root/root.

Change-Id: I9f7b046b85203da20f022b6ee959290485b6aabd

commit_message:
opensuse: move suse jobs to non-voting

The jobs have been broken for weeks now, let's move it to non-voting
to give a chance to the openSUSE team to fix it.

Change-Id: I39eb084e3bd4140e0747150ae718508c1f307192

commit_message:
Change Cinder API version in the documentation

Cinder API v3 is a default version for Horizon so we need
to use it in the documentation.

data-processing API version is removed from the Horizon
documentation since it's availale in a separate plugin.

Change-Id: I5f178b70f73c23f8220f44a418eec689f0bc3b1c

[{'created': '2019-04-05 13:24:26.000000000', 'message': 'Create symlink to neutron-keepalived-state-change

Neutron tries to hit up neutron-keepalived-state-change bin
and looks for it in /usr/local/bin.

The workaround for this is to create a symlink of the bin
file inside the venv to the place neutron expects.

Change-Id: Id3ca9b81d946a07d74157578981c78b2e35f02ff
(cherry picked from commit 1ea1e654a3321882e6cc9ef836085514eefc13bc)

commit_message:
Create symlink to neutron-keepalived-state-change

Neutron tries to hit up neutron-keepalived-state-change bin
and looks for it in /usr/local/bin.

The workaround for this is to create a symlink of the bin
file inside the venv to the place neutron expects.

Depends-On: I0044a3e80be05f27a865f57ecf3c09605b3aa93e
Change-Id: Id3ca9b81d946a07d74157578981c78b2e35f02ff
(cherry picked from commit 1ea1e654a3321882e6cc9ef836085514eefc13bc)

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie05dd95eaef3d0030d9b3a46602751ddb191d957

commit_message:
Add Leap 15 jobs

We have leap 15 support in roles, yet, we don't add it to the
template. This should be adding 15.0 as non voting job everywhere.

Change-Id: Ia59e4007e1e39bfbb74fbee6432315afd9be495d

subject: Use pkill for lxc-dnsmasq systemd unit file
messages: [{'account_id': 290, 'date': '2019-04-12 17:42:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-04-13 23:23:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2019-04-14 07:24:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-12 17:42:33.000000000', 'message': "Use pkill for lxc-dnsmasq systemd unit file

Previously psmisc was not installed by default, causing
the killall in the lxc-dnsmasq systemd unit file to
silently fail if killall wasn't found.  This prevented
running instances of dnsmasq to be torn down when
restarting the service.

This would exhibit as a problem during upgrades as
the older dnsmasq service would be running and the
new service would be unable to take over the port.
This would cause lxc containers to lose connectivity.

This commit switches to using pkill and ensures procps
is always installed by default.

Change-Id: I4fa838706f1163fd68ff68258bfc66cbf13bad94
"}]
commit_message:
Use pkill for lxc-dnsmasq systemd unit file

Previously psmisc was not installed by default, causing
the killall in the lxc-dnsmasq systemd unit file to
silently fail if killall wasn't found.  This prevented
running instances of dnsmasq to be torn down when
restarting the service.

This would exhibit as a problem during upgrades as
the older dnsmasq service would be running and the
new service would be unable to take over the port.
This would cause lxc containers to lose connectivity.

This commit switches to using pkill and ensures procps
is always installed by default.

Change-Id: I4fa838706f1163fd68ff68258bfc66cbf13bad94

commit_message:
Use XStatic-D3 instead of vendorized d3.js

According to [1] d3.js will be loaded by horizon on the each page
so we don't need to include it manually.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/4e0ee573db4561dc7e0c10835d31d73eddb12aca/openstack_dashboard/utils/settings.py#L196

Story: 2004051
Task: 30403

Change-Id: Icb56905a802f9efba7f9c6558372b62ab5eb9bd4

commit_message:
Fix the verification method before creating and updating the firewall rule

1.Verify the validity of the icmp port when the protocol is configured.
2.When updating the rule, the modified data should be verified.

Change-Id: I4c4b1cc5ff25b67e77669b721df4fdbb7d47515f
Closes-Bug: #1803499

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: I687dd60f235fac20af3874f38ad7ab27c2a6f087
'}]
commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: I687dd60f235fac20af3874f38ad7ab27c2a6f087

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-12 16:54:10.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure the build host is the first repo server

The first repo server is the only one configured to synchronise
packages to the other repo servers. To ensure that the build
happens on the first server, we reverse the order in which they
are processed in the loop.

This does not solve the multi-architecture use-case. A solution
for that will have to follow.

Change-Id: Ie6bd16ac08164f7dba71339858b98137f61ad716
'}, {'created': '2019-04-12 18:28:51.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure the build host is the first repo server

The first repo server is the only one configured to synchronise
packages to the other repo servers. To ensure that the build
happens on the first server, we reverse the order in which they
are processed in the loop.

This does not solve the multi-architecture use-case. A solution
for that will have to follow.

Change-Id: Ie6bd16ac08164f7dba71339858b98137f61ad716
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure the build host is the first repo server

The first repo server is the only one configured to synchronise
packages to the other repo servers. To ensure that the build
happens on the first server, we reverse the order in which they
are processed in the loop.

This does not solve the multi-architecture use-case. A solution
for that will have to follow.

Change-Id: Ie6bd16ac08164f7dba71339858b98137f61ad716

commit_message:
Collect all of systemd configuration

Collect /etc/systemd instead of /etc/systemd/network. OSA drops a
considerable amount of other configuration in /etc/systemd, such
as custom units, resolved configuration, etc. When debugging gate
failures, the unit files will be very helpful to see logged.

Change-Id: I9371e3d98f7581c2210a0e18ac3e2970847ce411

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-04 03:54:35.000000000', 'message': 'docs: drop sphinxmark

sphinxmark is no longer compatible with the latest release of Sphinx
which is causing all of our documentation jobs to fail.  This patch
removes it as our current usage of openstacktheme for documentation

branch the documentation covers.

Change-Id: I7eeca9d7f5a519bdcd4ceedd1b2bb64540b163c0
'}, {'created': '2019-04-04 05:14:14.000000000', 'message': 'docs: drop sphinxmark

Change-Id: I7eeca9d7f5a519bdcd4ceedd1b2bb64540b163c0

commit_message:
docs: drop sphinxmark

sphinxmark is no longer compatible with the latest release of Sphinx
which is causing all of our documentation jobs to fail.  This patch
removes it as our current usage of openstacktheme for documentation
already provides watermarks for current branch and notices for which
branch the documentation covers.

Change-Id: I7eeca9d7f5a519bdcd4ceedd1b2bb64540b163c0
