commit_message:
Update master for stable/stein

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/stein.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/stein.

Change-Id: I39bd180e78f9eb92d7962854b3282675d04f186e
Sem-Ver: feature

breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Idf52b7aeecc46b3ff14cf9e2b3a7c4401987c574
Closes-Bug:  #1801657

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

commit_message:
Set container_name as host_var in test inventory

The connection plugin no longer falls back on using the
inventory_hostname as the container_name. Set container_name as a host
var for each container in the test inventory.

Change-Id: Ia8ef095c2cc2001775276f7d33151c7632b4e15f

Without installing dumb-init, we can't use it as an ENTRYPOINT.
Overiding the outer block would ensure all dumb-init related
changes overridden in all templates. Though can be litte
confusing , let's keep the outer block name the same for
backward  compatibility (overridden TripleO downstream that
does not use dumb-init).

commit_message:
Add config option use_dumb_init to add it to container images

Usage of dumb-init can also be disabled from cli with
`--nouse-dumb-init` when building images.

Also moves ENTRYPOINT outside of dumb_init_installation
block.

Change-Id: Id32d54fc9913b83cf121ede5a5e265e0772062ae
Related-Bug: #1821970

commit_message:
mq_setup: run notify setup *only* if users are different

The tasks for notification always run as the variables are mostly
defined with the same values as the normal message queue.

This patch skips creating the notification vhost/user if they
are matching the messaging one.

Change-Id: I03c2192b844f99648fe8b9c60e33b359f3997360

As of Stein, a minimum of python-cinderclient 4.0.0 is required to

commit_message:
Set min version of python-cinderclient to 4.0.0

As of Stein, a minimum of python-cinderclient 4.0.0 is required to
create a volume. Cinder schema no longer accepts additional
properties on volume create that are not part of the API spec [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573093/

Change-Id: I0fc4d5db39080985b471fe2465b7078e37417e4d
Closes-Bug: #1824017

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-28 15:54:10.000000000', 'message': "Check for build request even if instance mapping doesn't exist

It is possible that an inconsistent state of the database could
lead to a build request being created but an instance mapping
failing to be created.  In this case, you end up with an instance
that cannot be retrieved even though it has a build request.

This patch add tests to check if an instance exists with a build
request and without a mapping and fixes the code to make sure to
return that build request if the instance mapping is missing, in
order to allow for deleting these instances.

Change-Id: Ieee6a0c8b1b1a1644d008da33cbd5512d096d4b1
Closes-Bug: #1784093
"}]
commit_message:
Check for build request even if instance mapping doesn't exist

It is possible that an inconsistent state of the database could
lead to a build request being created but an instance mapping
failing to be created.  In this case, you end up with an instance
that cannot be retrieved even though it has a build request.

This patch add tests to check if an instance exists with a build
request and without a mapping and fixes the code to make sure to
return that build request if the instance mapping is missing, in
order to allow for deleting these instances.

Change-Id: Ieee6a0c8b1b1a1644d008da33cbd5512d096d4b1
Closes-Bug: #1784093

FTR, I'm more or less OK with this given the weirdness around how metadata API versions are traditionally one per release, excluding whatever happened with NEWTON_ONE and NEWTON_TWO. And hostId is the same hashed value that you'd get out of the compute REST API which is available to the tenant, i.e. w/o this change, I can create my server, get the hostId from GET /servers/{id}, post that into the server's metadata and then get it reflected back into the guest via the metadata API. This just makes that whole roundabout operation more streamlined."}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-06-25 22:38:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

For more details on this and other bugs, please see http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/"}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-06-25 23:26:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2018-06-25 23:41:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

AFAIK, metadata within configdrive is not refreshed after a live migration. The configdrive is copied as-is to the destination host. Therefore the hostId could be stalled/outdated in some cases.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-06-26 00:17:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-20658 : SUCCESS in 49m 39s'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-06-26 00:30:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I considered that case but realistically all of the metadata could be out of date because ConfigDrive is a one time thing anyways.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-06-26 04:08:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with check hyper-v

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/577933/2/ : FAILURE in 2h 36m 18s'}, {'account_id': 6062, 'date': '2018-06-26 13:06:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

I think a bp need to be written because this anyway a API change though only metadata API

and I think we probably want to update the doc given by Matt to use the latest format you added'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-26 16:06:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I considered that case but realistically all of the metadata could be out of date because ConfigDrive is a one time thing anyways.

Including the availability zone? Although once you create a server in an AZ you shouldn't be allowed to migrate out of it unless the AZ Filter is disabled (does anyone actually disable that?)."}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-06-27 09:02:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-06-27 15:11:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2

Hi Mohammed,

AFAIAC, this clearly violates the principle of least privilege and exposes administrative domain information to the virtual/guest domain. This is definitely something we've held a hard line against crossing in the past.

While it may indeed be useful for certain operators to be able to identify the physical host machines that VMs are on, this isn't something that belongs in the guest domain. Guests are intended to be unaware of the physical hardware they run on (one of the key tenets of virtualization) partly because of security/privilege concerns and partly because exposing that kind of information makes the migration of guests much more difficult (because the guests will inevitably come to rely or hardcode that host identifying information).

So, I'm afraid I'm a hard -2 on this one, sorry :(

-jay"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-27 16:22:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> AFAIAC, this clearly violates the principle of least privilege and exposes administrative domain information to the virtual/guest domain. This is definitely something we've held a hard line against crossing in the past.

This doesn't expose the actual compute host at all, it's the same hashed host+project_id "hostId" parameter a non-admin user can get out of the compute REST API:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/c8b93fa2493dce82ef4c0b1e7a503ba9b81c2e86/nova/api/openstack/compute/views/servers.py#L135'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-06-27 17:08:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

Sincere apologies. I was not aware that the host name and project ID were hashed together in a SHA-224.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-28 14:57:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

As discussed in the nova meeting today, if we can have a docs patch to add something about how config drive is stale after the server is created and therefore it can only be trusted on initial boot:

https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/user/config-drive.html

Then I'm more comfortable with this change. Extra points if we can identify at least a couple of server operations that will rebuild the config drive (I think rebuild and shelve offload/unshelve for sure, not sure about hard reboot though)."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-28 14:57:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'm not sure if rebuild will rebuild the config drive if you're on shared storage though..."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-28 15:22:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-04-13 17:12:30.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Add hostId to metadata service

The hostId is an extremely useful piece of information for instances
which can help in troubleshooting by finding out if instances are
running on the same compute node or for services that need to do
any scheduling by having awareness of which VMs are colocated on
the same compute node.

This patch adds the `hostId` inside the Rocky version of the
metadata alongside the tests it needs.

Change-Id: Ib366d95e119f4b0f37aa2bed46e5899e735d590f

commit_message:
Introduce new percentage based RAM weigher

The existing RAM weigher depends only on the total amount of
free memory in a hypervisor.  This can be an issue in
environments where the amount of total memory in hypervisors
is different, where the scheduler will stack on the hyperviors
with a lot of memory, creating hotspots of usage across
the cluster.

This patch introduces a new percentage based RAM weigher which
will help in these cases, allowing to instead weigh on the
percentage of free memory.

Change-Id: I741426e22b3fda5024a111c011e64524f7dd243e

commit_message:
failover: add negative test for failover without amps

It is possible that the amphora gets deleted during failover
but not properly re-created which leaves the load balancer in
a state where it cannot be failed over due to the fact that
it has no amphorae assigned to it.

Change-Id: I1a2d4dda7c68df616beed4c5fb7f5b40ef6ae78f
Story: #2004440
Task: #28104

Add murano_auth configuration

Murano seems to use murano_auth in order to properly authenticate
against V3, this patch properly configures it.

commit_message:
Fix missing openstack_hosts_centos_mirror_url

It looks a backport that had a conflict resolution missed a
change and did not add `openstack_hosts_centos_mirror_url`
which meant that we were always installing without mirrors
inside Pike for RDO.

Change-Id: Ie251e56954a2a9dfa4920a5c8cb6a8cd8d6e06a2

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-20434 : SUCCESS in 51m 42s'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-06-21 10:09:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with check hyper-v

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/576944/1/ : FAILURE in 2h 59m 39s'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-25 16:56:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Obviously tests, docs, release note needed. Seems like a sane idea though. I'm not sure how much deployment tools are going to be using this though since it might be kind of hard to automate the recovery for each scenario - and you'll only be doing that once most likely, e.g. if you screwed up placement or cells v2 stuff, you should hit that once (in pre-prod?), fix the deployment scripts and then be good to go."}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-06-25 18:20:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

So the idea behind this is to actually let the deployment tools automatically figure out which actions to automatically run by parsing the output.

The idea of running it first to know what you have to do is the idea here rather than blindly just restarting things.. I can imagine this is beneficial in other deployment projects too.

I'll try to have a more polished patch up soon at some point."}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-04-13 17:10:05.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-20 19:21:46.000000000', 'message': 'Add machine output for nova-status upgrade checks

It is quite hard to predict what will need to be done during an
upgrade by an automated system and aimlessly just running upgrade
related tasks in a deployment might introduce all sorts of issues.

The following patch adds a `--machine` argument to the nova-status
upgrade check command which prints out only warning/error messages,
one every line.

Orchestration and installation tools can run this once and ignore
the exit status, go through the steps required to handle each one
such as restart placement if it notices `PLACEMENT_OUT_OF_DATE` in
the output and then runs it again, checking the exit code the
second time around as it should have taken care of all the needed
steps.

Change-Id: Iaa83b014f6b44dc291604f5d7ffa1608cef1becf
'}]
commit_message:
Add machine output for nova-status upgrade checks

It is quite hard to predict what will need to be done during an
upgrade by an automated system and aimlessly just running upgrade
related tasks in a deployment might introduce all sorts of issues.

The following patch adds a `--machine` argument to the nova-status
upgrade check command which prints out only warning/error messages,
one every line.

Orchestration and installation tools can run this once and ignore
the exit status, go through the steps required to handle each one
such as restart placement if it notices `PLACEMENT_OUT_OF_DATE` in
the output and then runs it again, checking the exit code the
second time around as it should have taken care of all the needed
steps.

Change-Id: Iaa83b014f6b44dc291604f5d7ffa1608cef1becf

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-27 15:30:21.000000000', 'message': "redhat: stop updating system unnecessarily

In RHEL-based operating systems, the update will actually attempt
to update every single package in the system which can result in
bad things (i.e. updating services when they're not supposed to).

The intention was to do the same as the apt-get update which simply
updates the repos. however this is not necessary in CentOS.

Change-Id: I5a1f86899406e125b3a790e2e85ce36d73fbc55e
(cherry picked from commit b15b97fa0ab73579e4939ae767a2810196b33df2)
"}]
commit_message:
redhat: stop updating system unnecessarily

In RHEL-based operating systems, the update will actually attempt
to update every single package in the system which can result in
bad things (i.e. updating services when they're not supposed to).

The intention was to do the same as the apt-get update which simply
updates the repos. however this is not necessary in CentOS.

Change-Id: I5a1f86899406e125b3a790e2e85ce36d73fbc55e
(cherry picked from commit b15b97fa0ab73579e4939ae767a2810196b33df2)

commit_message:
Check for keys ending with git_install_branch

In order for py_pkgs to parse a file for Git packages, it looks
for any keys ending with git_repo.  However, if you are trying to
pin to an upstream commit, you may be confused that things are
not working.

This changes the behaviour so that if you specify an install
branch, it will treat the file as one which contains Git packages
rather than relying on the fact that a repo is configured.

Change-Id: I08bf1bdb103871a8cd282fc78982b54ee2b900a6

commit_message:
nspawn: enable jobs

This commit enables and adds the nspawn jobs into our check
pipeline, once the jobs are stable and we've moved all roles
to test using integrated repo with nspawn, we can move them
to voting.

Change-Id: I386a919e6ee674ce81244cee99da8bf7533b9ad1

It is problematic to be using macvlan interfaces to provide networking
therefore, we're going to switch back to using a normal veth pair and

"}]
commit_message:
nspawn: setup basic networking structure

It is problematic to be using macvlan interfaces to provide networking
therefore, we're going to switch back to using a normal veth pair and
bridge for the flat/public network only.

Change-Id: I9d7c89fc2d3a0a29cac083eaf7fbc5f8e94f8b0a

commit_message:
Switch to downloading images from LXC mirrors

This patch allows downloading directly from the LXC mirrors by
default which seem to be fairly reasonable source of truth.

They are also mirrored in the OpenStack infrastructure so they
should be faster to pull down and more reliable.  The option
to specify a URL is still available.

Depends-On: I092d6b404353669d29867e19d95196daffaab84a
Change-Id: Ia9feeb66f82071031106659219e2a90f70678e9a

commit_message:
Enable passing nspawn jobs

This patch contains a few changes which are squashed in order
to make it much easier to backport to Rocky.

- Added management network configuration for `mv-container`
- Renamed tasks to create mounts to correct ones
- Converted AIO and AIO nspawn configurations to match network
  values.
- Added dummy interfaces and br-vlan for all deployments

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/619343
Change-Id: Ib3d66d072b074ef5bb7851dcab7d5455f2b5693f

commit_message:
Drop py35 jobs

Python 3.5 was the target runtime for the Rocky release. The current
target py3 runtime for Stein is Python 3.6, so there is no reason to
keep testing against the older version.

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html#python-runtime-for-stein

Change-Id: Idec9e2647090ee7329330d4b5727b037c60891c7

[{'created': '2019-04-10 09:24:46.000000000', 'message': "Use ironic inspector 'dnsmasq' PXE filter by default

With Docker CE, the daemon sets the default policy of the iptables
FORWARD chain to DROP. This causes problems for provisioning bare metal
servers when ironic inspector is used with the 'iptables' PXE filter.
It's not entirely clear why these two things interact in this way,
but switching to the 'dnsmasq' filter works around the issue, and is
probably a good move anyway because it is more efficient.

(cherry picked from commit 86e83faeb1fd088d44c5108a5ec835eba6316b2d)
"}]
commit_message:
Use ironic inspector 'dnsmasq' PXE filter by default

With Docker CE, the daemon sets the default policy of the iptables
FORWARD chain to DROP. This causes problems for provisioning bare metal
servers when ironic inspector is used with the 'iptables' PXE filter.
It's not entirely clear why these two things interact in this way,
but switching to the 'dnsmasq' filter works around the issue, and is
probably a good move anyway because it is more efficient.

We have added a migration task here to flush and remove the ironic-inspector
iptables chain since inspector does not do this itself currently.

Change-Id: Iceed5a096819203eb2b92466d39575d3adf8e218
Closes-Bug: #1823044
(cherry picked from commit 86e83faeb1fd088d44c5108a5ec835eba6316b2d)

'}, {'created': '2019-04-02 10:23:44.000000000', 'message': 'Allow more generic overrides for ceilometer-api

With this patch we allow for a more easy way of overriding some
of the values that may be used in other distros while maintainting
the default values if those values are not overriden.

The following values are introduced to be overriden:
conf:
  software:
    apache2:
      conf_dir:
      site_dir:
      mods_dir:
      binary:
      start_flags:
      a2enmod:
      a2dismod:
      security:

On which:
 * conf_dir: directory where to drop the config files
 * site_dir: directory where to drop the enabled virtualhosts
 * mods_dir: directory where to drop any mod configuration
 * binary: the binary to use for launching apache
 * start_flags: any flags that will be passed to the apache binary call
 * a2enmod: mods to enable
 * a2dismod: mods to disable
 * security: security configuration for apache

Notice that if there is no overrides given, it should not affect anything
and the templates will not be changed as the default values are set to what
they used to be as to not disrupt existing deployments.

Change-Id: Ibb7e3bec0f6561bccc6a1aea907a2f3e4e1bfb73

commit_message:
Allow more generic overrides for ceilometer-api

With this patch we allow for a more easy way of overriding some
of the values that may be used in other distros while maintainting
the default values if those values are not overriden.

The following values are introduced to be overriden:
conf:
  security:
  software:
    apache2:
      conf_dir:
      site_dir:
      mods_dir:
      binary:
      start_flags:
      a2enmod:
      a2dismod:

On which:
 * conf_dir: directory where to drop the config files
 * site_dir: directory where to drop the enabled virtualhosts
 * mods_dir: directory where to drop any mod configuration
 * binary: the binary to use for launching apache
 * start_flags: any flags that will be passed to the apache binary call
 * a2enmod: mods to enable
 * a2dismod: mods to disable
 * security: security configuration for apache

Notice that if there is no overrides given, it should not affect anything
and the templates will not be changed as the default values are set to what
they used to be as to not disrupt existing deployments.

Change-Id: Ibb7e3bec0f6561bccc6a1aea907a2f3e4e1bfb73

commit_message:
Enable audit pipeline for glance

This change adds the keystonemiddleware audit paste filter[0]
and enables it for the glance-api and glance-registry services.
This provides the ability to audit API requests for glance.

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/keystonemiddleware/latest/audit.html

Change-Id: I3b42717dbc11257c21b27e7c68dedc3283e1bd34

commit_message:
Don't use easy_install on Ubuntu 18+

Currently easy_install is not available on Ubuntu 18+ due to [1]. In
that case, install pip via apt rather than easy_install.

[1]
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/python-setuptools/+bug/1774419

Change-Id: Id358fdb655d71490b0915680dff131cfe33f4a40
Closes-Bug: #1813492
(cherry picked from commit c1c02f67dcb28a8722d505ddf6a24a37c1f874d7)

commit_message:
Enable audit pipeline for panko

This change adds the keystonemiddleware audit paste filter[0]
and enables it for the panko-api service.
This provides the ability to audit API requests for panko.

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/keystonemiddleware/latest/audit.html

Change-Id: I5c0e3c61317483d36fcb05ebff8b377941675c27

[{'created': '2019-04-12 23:37:33.000000000', 'message': 'Update minimum hardware version

hardware had a bug in ppc64le (and a slightly different bug on aarch64)
this creates a regression and means that introspection on those
architectures fail.

Update the minimum required version to 0.20.1 to get the bugfix

Change-Id: I583dd9f164eae33f7c8cac4505df76e57415aa93
See: https://github.com/redhat-cip/hardware/issues/80
'}]
commit_message:
Update minimum hardware version

hardware had a bug in ppc64le (and a slightly different bug on aarch64)
this creates a regression and means that introspection on those
architectures fail.

Update the minimum required version to 0.20.1 to get the bugfix

Change-Id: I583dd9f164eae33f7c8cac4505df76e57415aa93
See: https://github.com/redhat-cip/hardware/issues/80

subject: Delete constraints and requirements files on build fail
messages: [{'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-04-12 22:29:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2019-04-12 22:29:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2019-04-13 08:35:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-12 22:29:26.000000000', 'message': 'Delete constraints and requirements files on build fail

If the installation of Python packages fails for any reason, the
constraint and requirements file is already written and therefore
unless you delete the virtualenv, it would not rebuild things
again.

This patch will handle failure and delete those files, then provide
a warning for the user upon failing to inspect the needed file.

Closes-Bug: #1824189

Change-Id: I67db44ce10250908f23c26c90d271a780a875eb6
(cherry picked from commit b2abfe4bad7e7b440e79b048461cfbfda2b06757)
'}]
commit_message:
Delete constraints and requirements files on build fail

If the installation of Python packages fails for any reason, the
constraint and requirements file is already written and therefore
unless you delete the virtualenv, it would not rebuild things
again.

This patch will handle failure and delete those files, then provide
a warning for the user upon failing to inspect the needed file.

Closes-Bug: #1824189

Change-Id: I67db44ce10250908f23c26c90d271a780a875eb6
(cherry picked from commit b2abfe4bad7e7b440e79b048461cfbfda2b06757)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-08 15:35:04.000000000', 'message': 'Do not log a warning about not using compute monitors

The compute_monitors configuration option is empty by
default, however, on nova-compute startup we get a warning
logged saying:

  Excluding nova.compute.monitors.cpu monitor virt_driver. \
  Not in the list of enabled monitors (CONF.compute_monitors).

This is unnecessary noise in the logs when nova-compute is
not configured to use monitors, so this change avoids the warning
log message in that case.

The compute_monitors configuration option help text is also
updated to (1) fix formatting and (2) remove the mention of the
numa_mem_bw monitor which never made it into nova (see
blueprint memory-bw).

Change-Id: I5bd204e0017f6f795e3cf13b34b75124ee23aa78
Closes-Bug: #1823207
(cherry picked from commit 8795f591d541227cd704019f19f3a78c74fc8ac7)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not log a warning about not using compute monitors

The compute_monitors configuration option is empty by
default, however, on nova-compute startup we get a warning
logged saying:

  Excluding nova.compute.monitors.cpu monitor virt_driver. \
  Not in the list of enabled monitors (CONF.compute_monitors).

This is unnecessary noise in the logs when nova-compute is
not configured to use monitors, so this change avoids the warning
log message in that case.

The compute_monitors configuration option help text is also
updated to (1) fix formatting and (2) remove the mention of the
numa_mem_bw monitor which never made it into nova (see
blueprint memory-bw).

Change-Id: I5bd204e0017f6f795e3cf13b34b75124ee23aa78
Closes-Bug: #1823207
(cherry picked from commit 8795f591d541227cd704019f19f3a78c74fc8ac7)

commit_message:
Fix the kolla-build.conf path

kolla use oslo.config to manage config[0], the path of kolla-build should
be /etc/kolla/kolla-build.conf, rather than etc/kolla/kolla-build.conf

[0]: https://github.com/openstack/kolla/blob/master/kolla/image/build.py#L1240

Change-Id: If7b19b8ba26dc62ee2f76b56ed7314fe0538ebd8

commit_message:
Reduce the alarm_threshold value to make autoscaling test stable

telemetry-dsvm-integration sometimes failed due to
the alarm_threshold is too high[0], we can just deduce
the alarm_threshold value to make test stable.

[0]http://logs.openstack.org/62/643262/3/check/telemetry-dsvm-integration/9771ecc/logs/screen-aodh-evaluator.txt.gz#_Apr_11_15_36_33_279860

Change-Id: I63af7f6c804e123395b225244111543dedc67581

commit_message:
Enable audit pipeline for nova

This change adds the keystonemiddleware audit paste filter[0]
and enables it for the nova-api services.

This provides the ability to audit API requests for nova.

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/keystonemiddleware/latest/audit.html

Change-Id: Ic6df044d83f4dee581c9cc0405f61d926e45bcab
